, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">One effective fake historian\nwas <span style=\"color: blue;\"><b>Joseph Davey Cunningham</b></span> , the aide-de-camp to the Governor-General, Sir\nHenry Hardinge. &nbsp;His book made the Sikhs\nvery happy as he blamed Hindus for the fall of Maharaja Ranjit Singh . It made\nthe Sikhs very upset with the Hindus. He added some added criticism of his own\nboss to make himself appear as a great friend of Sikhs and a truthful guy ..</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">In\n&nbsp;Ranjit Singh\u2019s history if Dhian Singh is\nRam,&nbsp; Gulab Singh is Lakshman.. &nbsp;Cunningham died in Ambala, Haryana state in 1851\nAD of Cholera.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-aA_z6Y2Lyyk/UdnND8v2jYI/AAAAAAAAkAE/Q2IgWaRlIqY/s1600/download.jpgchm.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-aA_z6Y2Lyyk/UdnND8v2jYI/AAAAAAAAkAE/Q2IgWaRlIqY/s400/download.jpgchm.jpg\" width=\"266\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Another effective fake &nbsp;historian was <b style=\"color: blue;\">Sir John Malcolm</b> ( picture below ). Today you can\nsee his over life-size statue &nbsp;in\nWestminster Abbey. &nbsp;In June 1805 he was\nappointed chief agent of the governor-general of British Raj. &nbsp;His false history writing efforts set the\nfoundation for &nbsp;Sikhs to support white\ninvader Britain in the first war of Independence, against their own Indian\nbrothers.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-QhEMmYrcgjI/UdnMocK3qBI/AAAAAAAAj_4/pqhOSK0Zqp8/s1600/sjm.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-QhEMmYrcgjI/UdnMocK3qBI/AAAAAAAAj_4/pqhOSK0Zqp8/s1600/sjm.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">Lepel Henry Griffin </span></b>&nbsp;( photo below ) injected poison --&nbsp;that Hinduism had always been hostile to\nSikhism and even socially the two had been like cobra and mongoose . &nbsp;He was Rothschild\nchosen Governor-General's Agent in Central India and Resident in Indore, and\nalso resident in Hyderabad. In 1880 he became Chief Secretary of the Punjab. &nbsp;He\nserved Rothschild well and his younger of his two sons, Sir Lancelot Cecil\nLepel Griffin became the last political secretary of British India.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-pPeiJz2tuSc/UdnML43UZCI/AAAAAAAAj_w/y9HS-kHju3k/s1600/Sir_Lepel_Henry_Griffin.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-pPeiJz2tuSc/UdnML43UZCI/AAAAAAAAj_w/y9HS-kHju3k/s320/Sir_Lepel_Henry_Griffin.png\" width=\"237\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The British need to act\nfast. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Their &nbsp;Punjab Administration Report of 1851-52\nobserved : <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE &nbsp;\"The sacred tank at Amritsar is less\nthronged than formerly, and the attendance at the annual festival is\ndiminishing yearly. The initiatory ceremony for adults is now rarely performed.\nNot only did the fresh recruitment stop, but also a new exodus has begun.&nbsp; Khalsa Sikhs now join the ranks of mother\nreligion Hinduism whence they originally came, and bring up their children as\nHindus. This phenomenon is unabated \" UNQUOTE <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Another British &nbsp;Administration Report of 1854-55 says -<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE &nbsp;\" Now that the Sikh commonwealth is\nbroken up, people cease to be initiated into Sikhism and re- vert to Hinduism. Our\ncensus reveals that the Lahore division which included Manjha, the original\nhome of the Sikhs, &nbsp;has only 200,000\nSikhs in a population of three million \u201c-UNQUOTE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1869 AD German Jew\nRothschild sent one</span><b style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"> Dr. Ernest. Trumpp</span></b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">, a German Crypto Jew and Indologist &nbsp;to have a look at Sikh literature to find ways\nof injecting poison into it \u2013 &nbsp;or at\nleast remove all references to Hindu Vedas and Gods. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-kFbdVzWRKiA/Udm3kdQqxmI/AAAAAAAAj_g/uJecQN8Rtb8/s1600/170px-Ernst-trumpp-ex-schimmel.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-kFbdVzWRKiA/Udm3kdQqxmI/AAAAAAAAj_g/uJecQN8Rtb8/s320/170px-Ernst-trumpp-ex-schimmel.jpg\" width=\"242\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\">His report was to be\nfor Rothschild\u2019s eyes only. This was serious stuff .&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\">They needed to hold back millions\nof &nbsp;angry Indians using a few thousand\nsoldiers.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\">Deceit would be used at every step&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ernest Trumpp, who was\nRegius Professor of Oriental Languages at the University of Munich and member\nof Royal Bavarian Academny of Sciences. He knew 17 languages.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ernest Trumpp\u2019s job was\nto peruse the Sikh scriptures and prove that their theology and cosmology were totally\ndifferent from those of the Vedas and the Upanishads. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Trumpp painstakingly\ntranslated the Sikh scriptures into English.&nbsp;\nHe also&nbsp; translated &nbsp;Puratan and Bala Janamsakhis, the lives of the\nlater Sikh gurus, including an account of their teachings.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Trumpp wrote that &nbsp;Guru Nanak is &nbsp;a \"thorough Hindu,\" his religion\n\"a pantheism, derived directly from Hindu sources.\"&nbsp; Trumpp found nothing in the Sikh scriptures to\nsupport the view that Sikhism is separate from Hindusim.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Trumpp concluded that Adi\nGranth was not worth translating in full--\"the same few ideas, he thought,\nbeing endlessly repeated\". &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"The Adi Granth is\na very big volume, but, incoherent and shallow in the extreme, and couched at\nthe same time in dark and perplexing language, in order to cover these\ndefects....\"</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gilchrist said that the Dasam Granth was not\nworth translating at all. This book &nbsp;contains much of the texts attributed &nbsp;Guru Gobind Singh. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dasam Granth is separate granth is NOT the Guru\nGranth Sahib. &nbsp;The British called in a few\n\u201cSikh pride\u201d zealots and showed them Ernest &nbsp;Trumpp\u2019s work &nbsp;and they got very upset.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The British by then had\nmade their own manuscript of Puratan Janamsakhis (also spelt Janam-sakhi), the\nearliest known biography of Guru Nanak, from London. Trump stated that only the\nthe external marks of the Sikhs separated them from the Hindus and once these\nwere lost, &nbsp;they relapsed automatically into\nHinduism. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The studies of Rotshchild\nHorace Hayman Wilson, Monier Monier Williams ( Sanskrit scholar ) , and\nFriedrich Max Muller were also used by the British. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It must be noted that\nin 1813 Horace Hayman Wilson published the FAKE Sanskrit text with a &nbsp;free, translation in English of the FAKE and rhymed\nverse of FAKE Kalidasa's the Meghaduuta, or Cloud-Messenger.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punch into Google\nsearch-</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>KALIDASA DID NOT EXIST\nVADAKAYIL</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">John Oman Campbell who\nwrote the book \u201c Mystics, Ascetics and Saints of India\u201d in the late 19th\ncentury made two visits to the Golden Temple of the Sikhs and was of the\nconclusion, \u201cSikhism as a distinct religion possesses little vitality and by a\ngeneration or two will be reunited to Hinduism from where it sprang.&nbsp; The Sikhs who already bow down to the old\ndivinities of India, would not in all likelihood object to the formal admission\nof their Gurus and their Book into the Hindu Pantheon.\u201d &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">German linguist Ernest\nTrumpp's (1821-85) translation of parts of the Sikh scripture, was published\nunder the title The Adi Granth. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">He wrote that the Sikh scripture starts with\nthe words \"Ek Oankar.\" , whiich is nothing but Hindu king\nmantra OM and also looks the same. The syllable Om is also referred to as\nOmkara.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-wtixfcP5_jo/UdnQhG7awnI/AAAAAAAAkA0/u4sWLfq8Gkg/s1600/download.jpgOM.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-wtixfcP5_jo/UdnQhG7awnI/AAAAAAAAkA0/u4sWLfq8Gkg/s1600/download.jpgOM.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><i>OM has been lifted by Christians as AMEN, Jews as SHALOM and Muslims as 786 ( see OM symbol in mirror ) .</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Trumpps\nobservations&nbsp; where Hindusim and Sikhism\nmerged in the scriptures was noted . Later another white historian <b><span style=\"color: blue;\">Max Arthur\nMacauliffe</span></b> , converted himself into a Sikh to fool the na\u00efve Sikhs .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; color: red; font-size: large;\">Max Arthur Macauliff&nbsp;</span></b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">&nbsp;deleted\nand amended all such unwanted passages, to sanitise Sikh scriptures of anything which remotely resembled Hindusim.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Max Arthur Macauliffe\n(1841-1913) ,the British civil servant &nbsp;published\n\u201cego massage \u201c articles for the Sikhs in the 1870s. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-UIN9cSHW2GE/UdnPiOTeO9I/AAAAAAAAkAc/nGbQq4TXvmI/s1600/download.jpgefwfgwrs.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sikhs were so happy with <i><span style=\"color: blue;\">apna hi maal&nbsp;</span></i><b><span style=\"color: red;\">GORA SIKH</span></b>&nbsp;that in\n1893 he received Sikh institutional support to write a history of the Sikhs\nalong with translations of sacred texts. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">British stooge Maharaja\nRipudaman Singh who attended the coronation of King George V at Westminster on\n22 June 1911, was always told was to do by Rothschild stooge and Gandhi\u2019s mentor, a Hindu Gopal\nKrishna Gokhale. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maharaja Ripudaman was one of the biggest financial contributors\nand soldier manpower to the first World war effort of Rothschild. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Finally his own cousin Maharaja Bhupinder of\nPatiala told the British to depose him</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">on\n9 July 1923. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Poor Ripudaman baby!.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-m_QbsmVSd3M/Udq5uAFGQfI/AAAAAAAAkCI/jp44oFjGHBU/s1600/3f4th56.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-m_QbsmVSd3M/Udq5uAFGQfI/AAAAAAAAkCI/jp44oFjGHBU/s400/3f4th56.jpg\" width=\"249\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1927 he went on pilgrimage to Sri\nAbichalnagar Hazur Sahib, </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nanded, </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">where he took the Khalsa pahul (initiation\nrites) a second time and was renamed Gurcharan Singh. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">He died broken hearted with very little\npension doled out by the British at Kodaikanal on 13 December 1942.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When turbaned Max baby\ndecided to put his 6 volume book The Sikh Religion: Its Gurus, Sacred writings\nand Authors into the Clarendon Press in Oxford&nbsp;\nhe took his stooge Bhai Kahn Singh along in 1909.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Vol I deals with Guru\nNanak and the founding events. <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Vol. II deals with Guru\nAngad, Guru Amardas and Guru Ramdas. <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Vol. III deals with\nGuru Arjan Dev <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Vol IV deals with Guru\nHargobind, Guru Har Rai, Guru Har Krishan and Guru Tegh Bahadur, <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Vol V. deals with Guru\nGobind Singh. <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Vol. VI deals with\nearlier Bhagats (Bhakatas) whose hymns help make up the Guru Granth Sahib.</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The British made sure\nthat every encyclopedia ( equivalent to today\u2019s History Channel ) including the\n11th edition of Encyclopedia Britannica , proclaimed that Sikhism is a separate\ntree and NOT a branch of Hindusim.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Later on Maharaja\nRipudaman Singh was discarded like the proverbial curry leaf\u2014 like how Gandhi\nwas discared after Israel was carved out and India got its Independence.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You will be shocked to\nknow that the NON- Tat Khalsa Sikhs participated in a Navy mutiny in 1946\u2014\nwhich finally propelled India to her freedom.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: small;\">Punch into Google\nsearch \u2013</span><b><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">INDIAN NAVY MUTINY VADAKAYIL</span></b><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Max baby died on 15th\nMarch 1913 in his London home, Sinclair Gardens, West Kensington.&nbsp; The Brits gave great fake propaganda that a\nIndian Muslim servant&nbsp; Muhammad,&nbsp; vouched that Macauliffe recited the\nJapu(ji),&nbsp; 10 minutes before he died.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Excuem me please \u2013 I am\nso touched that I must cry.\u2014</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>SNIFF !!</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>BOOO&nbsp;&nbsp;HOOOOOOO !!!!</b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1911, the Sikh\nEducational Conference in Rawalpindi rejected a resolution commending Max\nbaby\u2019s work.&nbsp; It was NOT that all Sikhs\nwere gullible .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Here are a list of\nGianis who had a tete e tete with Max baby.. Bhai Kahn Singh Nabha ,with Bhais\nNihal Singh , Sant Singh of Sialkote,&nbsp;\nBhais Ditt Singh, Gurmukh Singh, Rajinder Singh, Nihal Singh of Lahore;\nBhai Sardul Singh Giani, Prem Singh, Fateh Singh , Darbara Singh of Amritsar;\nBhai Sant Singh of Kapurthala; Bhai Bhagvan singh of Patiala , Bhai Dasaundha\nSingh of Firozpur,among many others .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Max Arthur Macauliffe\nsecured from Maharaja Sir Hira Singh of Nabha the services of Bhai Kahn Singh,\nthe royal tutor.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ugyEpklxK60/UdvolcYyP_I/AAAAAAAAkHk/s0snAIpPmz4/s1600/downloadrj5e.jpgxac.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"130\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ugyEpklxK60/UdvolcYyP_I/AAAAAAAAkHk/s0snAIpPmz4/s400/downloadrj5e.jpgxac.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Earlier the British\nrevived the Mata Sundri hard core Sikh faction establishment of Tat Khalsa (\nthe 'True Khalsa' ) Singh Sabha in Lahore in 1879, as a political rival to the\nmoderate peace loving&nbsp; Sanatan Sikh\nSabha. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Sanatan Dharma\nSikhism acknowledged&nbsp; its roots in the\nVedic culture and believes in Hindu-Sikh unity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Sundri Mata unit of\nTat Khalsas were hell bent on having a separate&nbsp;\nSikh identity,&nbsp; separate from the\nHindus who were still traditionally donating the eldest child as a Sikh.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The white invader\neasily put a wedge between the Sikhs and non-Sikh Punjabis , by injecting funds\nto Tat Khalsa , giving moral support and subverting all literature.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sikh soldiers continued\nbeing servile to their prophesized white masters wearing TOPEE . For the Tat\nKhalsa Sikhs, the British shit did NOT smell.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Soon after their\nestablishment, the Tat Khalsas with the institutional support of the colonial\nChristian missionaries&nbsp; and rulers, began\nthrowing out the Jathedars from the management of the Gurudwaras. Force was\nused force when needed.&nbsp; If needed blood\nwas spilt.. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To promote this new\nSikh identity separate from the former glory of Hindu-SikhBanda Bahadur and\nRanjit Singh&nbsp; days,&nbsp; a foul reform movement was initiated.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All older source\nmaterial was suppressed, marginalized, denied, invalidated or even, as in case\nof Gurbilas, banned outright. &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sikh scriptures were\ntotally reinterpreted to expunge any hint of Hindu-ness in them.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Every&nbsp; Hindu fresco, painting and murti were removed\nfrom every Gurudwaras and all practices deemed to be Hindu were discontinued. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rumours were spread\nthat the Jathedars were promoting rituals that were 'forbidden by the Gurus'.\nand they were assaulted and some had their bones broken .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">HariMandir ( Vishnu\nTemple) became to be known as Darbar Sahib, which is Arabic for 'The court of\nGod'.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1905, the murtis removed from HariMandir\nincluded life sized murtis of Lord Vishnu, Chandi-Durga, Lord Krishna, Lord\nShiva and even&nbsp; Guru Ram Das Sodhi,\nthe&nbsp; Son in law of the third guru&nbsp; Guru Amar Das.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Why should Guru Amardas be\ndishonoured ? \u2013 he did NOT have Guru Nanak\u2019s blood , but he had Guru Gobind\nSingh\u2019s blood.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/--VrUIUigCew/UdvoUqueMaI/AAAAAAAAkHc/5K0O3HdiUAM/s1600/1019211.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/--VrUIUigCew/UdvoUqueMaI/AAAAAAAAkHc/5K0O3HdiUAM/s400/1019211.jpg\" width=\"300\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gurubanis were highly\nmistranslated wholesale and Janamsakhis of Guru Nanak Devji were injected with\npoison. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Guru Nanak and all\nGurus who were Khatri Hindus&nbsp; had never\npermitted&nbsp; Hindu bashing.&nbsp;&nbsp; But Tat Khaksa Sikhs would believe only the\nwhite Sardarjee messiah evangelist Macauliffe.&nbsp;\nMind you, Max baby was forced to&nbsp;\nrevised his translation 7 times to suit Rothschild .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Whenever moderate Sikhs\ndisputed anything the&nbsp; British would step\nin as adjudicator and fan the fires. But their conculsions were always on the\nside of the Sundi group Tat Khalsa.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Let me present an moderate example of Macauliffe\u2019s,&nbsp; Rothschild\nvetted works - <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Dilli takht par bahegi\naap Guru ki fauj <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Chatter phirega sis\npaar barhi karegi mauj <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>&nbsp;Raj karega khalsa aaki rahe na koe <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Khwar hoe sab milenge\nbache saran jo hoye</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The army of your Guru\nwill overrun the throne of Delhi&nbsp; The\nMantle will unfold on your head and make you very happy.&nbsp; The khalsa will rule and no one should be\nleft out.&nbsp; Those who will resort to the\nkhalsa will overcome all evils.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The events of 1857 had\ncreated a brand new identity for the Sikhs and this ideal of a parallel\nnationalism <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">dominated by the wicked\npolitics continue to haunt the desh bhakt Sikhs even after&nbsp; the passing <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">away of colonialism .<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-zkCP9D2tNFg/UdvoJtylwqI/AAAAAAAAkHU/iBWO6NusGRs/s1600/2005-11-04_Bhai_Mani_Singh_jee.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"297\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-zkCP9D2tNFg/UdvoJtylwqI/AAAAAAAAkHU/iBWO6NusGRs/s400/2005-11-04_Bhai_Mani_Singh_jee.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It was he Max baby\ninserted terms such as Sikhs only bowing before the Granth and nothing\nelse.&nbsp; Like how Muslims will bow only to\nthe Koran.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Max baby for all his\npopularity with the Tat Khalsa Sikhs is unknown in the west today. Even the\ncurrent Sikhs do NOT know this kingpin who revived and founded Mata\nSundri\u2019s&nbsp; Tat Khalsa,&nbsp; the radical section of the Singh Sabha reform\nmovement,&nbsp; heavily funded by Rothschild .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A leader of Tat Khalsa\nSingh Sabha was Bhai Gurmukh Singh, a professor at the Oriental College of\nLahore.&nbsp; He contacted Bhai Kanh Singh of\nNabha, a notable scholar, who wrote Mahan Kosh (encyclopedia of Sikhism) and\nHam Hindu Nahin (We are not Hindus).&nbsp;\nBritish stooges Bhai Gurmukh Singh and Bhai Kanh Singh cooperated with\nMax Arthur Macauliffe.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The hegemonic Tat Khalsa position, asserted that only\nthose initiated into the Tat Khalsa in accordance with the injunctions of Guru\nGobind Singh were true Sikhs.A poet of the Tat Khalsa is Vir Singh .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Max Arthur Macauliffe\nknew what he was doing when he wrote&nbsp; \u2013<i>\u201c. We\nknow the teachings of Socrates only through the writings of Plato and\nXenophon.&nbsp; Buddha has left no written\nmemorial of his teaching. Kungfu-tze, known to Europeans as Confucius, left no\ndocuments in which he detailed the principles of his moral and social\nsystem.&nbsp; The founder of Christianity did\nnot reduce his doctrines to writing and for them we are obliged to trust to the\ngospels according to Matthew, Mark, Luke and John.&nbsp; The prophet Muhammad did not himself reduce\nto writing the chapters of the Quran.&nbsp;\nThey were written or compiled by his adherents and followers.&nbsp; But the compositions of Sikh Gurus are\npreserved and we know at first hand what they taught\u201d </i><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-cSLBhO4wj1o/Udvn7kdHTJI/AAAAAAAAkHM/5E6YB4CfPb4/s1600/485402_611492448862350_1182608041_n.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em;
