, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Despite all the efforts\nof the separatist and hardcore Tat Khalsa and Max Arthur Mac Auliffe \u2014 let me\nquote excepts of some verses from the Sri Guru Granth Sahib, the holy book\ncurrently in the Golden temple Amritsar. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are 1431 pages .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Max baby may know 17\nlanguages . But he knows &nbsp;shit about\nHinduism. This is why each of the 1431 pages are FULL of Hindusim. Vedic and\nVedanta thoughts are all over each and every page. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Page 2 / Verse 4 : The\nGuru\u2019s &nbsp;Word is the <b>Wisdom of the Vedas</b>; &nbsp;the Guru\u2019s Word is all pervading. The <b>Guru is\nShiva, the Guru is Vishnu and Brahma; the Guru is Paarvati and Lakhshmi</b><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Page 2/ Verse 8: Listening \u0097<b>Shiva,\nBrahma and Indra</b>. Listening\u0097 even foul-mouthed people praise Him. Listening \u0097the\ntechnology of Yoga and the secrets of the body. Listening the <b>Shaastras, the\nSimritees and the Vedas</b>. O Nanak, the devotees are forever in bliss.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Page 3 / Verse 15 : The\nmythical bull is <b>Dharma</b>, the son of compassion; this is what patiently holds\nthe earth in its place. One who understands this becomes truthful. What a great\nload there is on the<b> bull</b> ! </span><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">( </span><span style=\"color: red;\">the load on\nthe bull is Lord Shiva</span></i><span style=\"color: blue;\"> )<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Page 4 / Verse 20: I\nbow to the Lord of the World, to His Word, to <b>Brahma the Creator</b>. He is\nBeautiful, True and Eternally Joyful. What was that time, and what was that\nmoment? What was that day, and what was that date? What was that season, and\nwhat was that month, when the Universe was created? The Pandits, the religious\nscholars, cannot find that time, even if itis written in the<b> Puraanas</b>. That\ntime is not known to the Qazis, who study the Koran.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Page 5 / Verse 25: The\n<b>Vedas and the Puraanas</b> speak. The scholars speak and lecture.<b> Brahma</b> speaks,\n<b>Indra </b>speaks. The <b>Gopis and Krishna</b> speak. <b>Shiva </b>speaks, the Siddhas speak.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Page 6 / Verse 27: <b>Shiva,\nBrahma</b> and the Goddess of Beauty, ever adorned, sing. <b>Indra</b>, seated upon His\nThrone, sings with the deities at Your Door. The <b>Siddhas in Samaadhi </b>sing; the\n<b>Saadhus </b>sing in contemplation. The celibates, the fanatics, the peacefully\naccepting and the fearless warriors sing. The Pandits, the religious scholars\nwho recite the<b> Vedas</b>, with the supreme sages of all the ages, sing. The\n<b>Mohinis</b>, the enchanting heavenly beauties who entice hearts in this world, in\nparadise, and in the underworld of the subconscious sing.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Page 7 / Verse 34: &nbsp;Nanak, when you go home, you will see this. ||34\n|| This is righteous living in the realm of Dharma. And now we speak of the\nrealm of spiritual wisdom. So many winds, waters and fires; so many <b>Krishnas\nand Shivas. </b>So many<b> Brahmas</b>, fashioning forms of great beauty, adorned and\ndressed in many colors. So many worlds and lands for working out karma. So very\nmany lessons to be learned! So many <b>Indras</b>, so many moons and suns, so many\nworlds and lands. So many Siddhas.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Page 8 : The Righteous\nJudge of Dharma sings at Your Door. Chitr and Gupt, the angels of the conscious\nand the subconscious who keep the record of actions, and the Righteous Judge of\nDharma who reads this record, sing of You.<b> Shiva, Brahma </b>and the Goddess of\nBeauty, ever adorned by You, sing of You. Indra, seated on His Throne, sings of\nYou, with the deities at Your Door. The Siddhas in Samaadhi sing of You; the\nSaadhus sing of You in contemplation.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Page 9 : The Pandits,\nthe religious scholars who recite the <b>Vedas</b>, with the supreme sages of all the\nages, sing of You. The Mohinis, the enchanting heavenly beauties who entice\nhearts in paradise, in this world, and in the underworld of the subconscious,\nsing of You.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Page 11 : O Dear\nInfinite Lord; they practice disciplined meditation and chant endlessly. For\nYou, many, for You, so very many read the various <b>Simritees and Shaastras</b>. They\nperform rituals and religious rites. Those devotees, those devotees are\nsublime, O servant Nanak, who are pleasing to my Dear Lord God.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Page 15: O Baba, the\nsplendor of Maya is deceptive. The blind man has forgotten the Name; he is in\nlimbo, neither here nor there.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Page 16: With the body\nof saffron, and the tongue a jewel, and the breath of the body pure fragrant\nincense; with the face anointed at the <b>sixty-eight holy places of pilgrimage</b>,\nand the heart illuminated with wisdom \u0097( </span><span style=\"color: red;\"><i>Pilgrimage\nis prohibited in Sikhism</i> </span><span style=\"color: blue;\">)<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Page 21: Wherever I\nlook, I see the Lord pervading there, in the union of <b>Shiva and Shakti</b>, of\n<b>consciousness and matter</b>. The three qualities hold the body in bondage; whoever\ncomes into the world is subject to their play.<b><o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>NOW JUST ONE &nbsp;EXAMPLE OF MAX BABY\u2019S POISON:-- </b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"color: red;\">Page 27: After all\ntheir reading, the Pandits, the religious scholars, and the astrologers argue\nand debate. Their intellect and understanding are perverted; &nbsp;they just dont\nunderstand. They are filled with greed and corruption. Through 8.4 million\nincarnations they wander lost and &nbsp;confused;\nthrough all their wandering and roaming, they are ruined. They act according to\ntheir pre-ordained destiny, which no one can&nbsp;\nerase .( </b><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">which religious book will\ntalk this way? Pray ? Prithee ?</span></i><span style=\"color: red;\">&nbsp;</span><b style=\"color: red;\">)<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thomas Patrick Hughes\nwas a British missionary who worked in India from 1865 to 1884. &nbsp;He wrote many books including \u201cDictionary of\nIsl\u0101m\u201d wherein he added an article about \u201cSikhism\u201d. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-1YOF6plA0eE/UdqwpN6rj5I/AAAAAAAAkB4/NRsx-LbGRKk/s1600/02.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-1YOF6plA0eE/UdqwpN6rj5I/AAAAAAAAkB4/NRsx-LbGRKk/s400/02.jpg\" width=\"293\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The reason offered by\nhim for adding an article about Sikhism in a book about Islam is that:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE \u201c\u2026it is enough\nfor the purposes of this article to have established the fact that Sikhism, in\nits inception, was intimately associated with Muhammadanism; and that it was\nintended as a means of bridging the gulf which separated the Hindus from the\nbelievers in the Prophet.\u201dUNQUOTE <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This was to prove that\nGuru Nanak is a Muslim, like what the Ahemadiyyas claim. Guru Nanak just accompanied\na Muslim friend to Mecca. &nbsp;Nowhere is it\nwritten that he went round the Kaaba ( which has a Shiva Lingam at the SE\ncorner 5 feet above the ground ) 7 times. If he had done it he would have\nwritten or told about it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hughes baby writes - QUOTE\nThe literature and traditions of Sikhism present a strange intermingling of\nHind\u016b and Muhammadan ideas; and this is so palpably apparent that oven\nsuperficial inquirers have been led to conclude that N\u0101nak purposely intended\nhis creed to be a compromise between those two great religions.UNQUOTE <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is after Guru\nNanak witnessed the brutal killings and the rale of dead women by the army of &nbsp;Babur .<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-rlmOZs3hapk/UdvnsD7143I/AAAAAAAAkHE/Bnjb_sw5s04/s1600/75285_220753261369088_594218026_n.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"308\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-rlmOZs3hapk/UdvnsD7143I/AAAAAAAAkHE/Bnjb_sw5s04/s640/75285_220753261369088_594218026_n.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Regarding the origin of\nSikhism, Reverend Hughes writes--</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201c Sikhism &nbsp;emerged out of Suf\u012bsm and t B\u0101b\u0101 N\u0101nak was\nhimself a Suf\u012b. &nbsp;Guru N\u0101nak, although a\nHindu by birth, came under Suf\u012b influence, and was strangely attracted by the\nsaintly demeanour of the faq\u012brs. &nbsp;In\npictures they are represented, with small rosaries in their hands, quite in\nMuhammadan fashion, as though ready to perform zikr\".&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"All\nthe Adi Granth&nbsp; verses composing the poem\nrhyme together, in singular conformity with the principle regulating the\nconstruction of the Persian ghazal.&nbsp; While\nmeeting Muslim dervishes, Guru Nanak used to greet them with Isl\u0101mic greeting\nof \u201cAssalam-o-Alaikum\u201d and receiving back the same greeting of\n\u201cWa-Alaikum-Assalam.&nbsp; Guru Nanak had a\nintimate relationship with with Shaikh Farid that lasted for twelve years.&nbsp; \u201d <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This Christian\nmissionary Hughes baby goes on and on\u2014<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Reverend Hughes also\ndescribes the meetings of B\u0101b\u0101 N\u0101nak with Shaikh Ibrahim, who saluted him us a\nMuslim, and had a conversation with him on the unity of God; Miyan Mitha, who\ncalled upon him for the Kalimah which leads to a long conversation, in which B\u0101b\u0101\nN\u0101nak lays emphasis on the Suf\u012b doctrine of the unity of God.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In this\nconversation, Nanak says, \"The book of the Qur'\u0101n should be\npractised.\" (fol.144) He also acknowledged that \"justice is the\nQur'\u0101n.\" (fol. 148) When the Miyan asked him what is the one great name,\nNanak took him aside and whispered it his ear, \"All\u0101h\". Immediately\nthe great name is uttered, Miyan Mitha is consumed to ashes; but a celestial\nvoice again utters the word All\u0101h!\" and the Miyan regains life, and falls\nat the feet of Nanak. (fol. 147)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">British used Gurdwaras &nbsp;power apart from Sikh aristocracy power , for\narm twisting the Sikhs. &nbsp;The British gave\nhuge dharmarths (grants) &nbsp;and in &nbsp;virtually controlled their Gurudwara administration\n. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The British followed\nthe precedent of Ranjit &nbsp;Singh since 1815\nin appointing a manager for the Golden Temple, Amritsar, to justify their &nbsp;appointing a manager of the shrine. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-G1cSyBTlgz0/Udvnher3s4I/AAAAAAAAkG8/RP2tAqd2-bs/s1600/6290061714508156.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"315\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-G1cSyBTlgz0/Udvnher3s4I/AAAAAAAAkG8/RP2tAqd2-bs/s400/6290061714508156.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The British Army\nRegulations laying emphasis on baptism for the Sikh soldiers, and they made it\ncompulsory. The Lt. Governor of Punjab, Sir Robert Egerton, and the Viceroy,\nLord Lansdowne, &nbsp;were patrons of the Tat\nKhalsa Sabha with radicalized at Amritsar. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The previous Sikh Sabha\nat Lahore had Hindus attending too, but NOT at Amritsar later.. The British\nhelped in creating a weekly, Gurmukhi Akhbar, to popularise the Sikh ideals .The\nTat Khalsa Sabhas constructed their own gurdwaras, with granthis, ragis, and\nupdeshaks, and they became centres of new revivalism. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1905, the British\narm twisted King Abdur Rahman of Afghanistan&nbsp;\nto throw out the Hindu idols inside the &nbsp;dharmsala (Gurdwara) Hari Rai in Kabul. &nbsp;&nbsp;A\nMuslim King declared that Hindus had no concern with Sikh shrines, as Sikhs had\nnothing to do with Hindi Thakurdwaras or Shivdwaras.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Despite all this Sikhs\nthemselves opposed the &nbsp;the removal of\nidols form the Golden Temple . There was blood shed inside the temple. Some\nSikhs shouted that the white Christian invader was doing &nbsp;\u2018divide and rule\u2019. However the radical Tat\nKhalsa, the Khalsa Advocate, the Khalsa Samachar, the Khalsa Sewak etc &nbsp;made sure that the gurudwaras were taken over.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">To reward the Sikhs for\nkilling their brother Indian Hindus and Muslims in 1857 war for freedom , the British in the 1871 census, &nbsp;enumerated the Sikhs as a &nbsp;separate community, for the first time.</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Let it be known that Rothschild\nstooge Scindia and Nizam of Hyderabad also supported the British in 1857. &nbsp;Today the young Scindia MP acts as he and his\nfamily are khandani desh bhakts, and will do anything for the Italian waitress\nturned empress.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Governor-General Lord\nCharles John Viscount Canning had passed an extraordinary fiat, reproduced below\nfrom The Calcutta Gazette, June 26, 1858 --</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><i>\u201c The\nRight Hon\u2019ble Governor General, in order to mark his appreciation of the Gwalior\nMaharajah Jayajirao Scindia\u2019s deep &nbsp;friendship,\nand his gratification at the re-establishment of His Highness\u2019 authority in his\nancestral dominions, was pleased &nbsp;to\ndirect that a Royal Salute shall be fired at every principal station in India.</i>\u201d</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ripudaman baby got only a &nbsp;15 gun salute , Jayajirao Scindia baby , when he kicked the bucket in 1886 was\nconferred a personal salute of 21 guns by the British .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Oh boy !! <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">SNIFF !&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I must cry now.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>BOOO &nbsp;HOOOOOO !</b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The British made sure\nthat &nbsp;Singh Sabhas were started, manned\nmostly by loyal ex-soldiers. &nbsp;These\nworked under Khalsa Diwans established at Lahore and Amritsar. &nbsp;They all wore the badge of loyalty to the foreigner\nBritish and hatred for the Indian Hindus and Muslims .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For the British it was a simple matter of\nbribery, intimidation and manipulation of Sikh leaders to sell their souls and create a new 'modern\nSikhism' . The ancient and historic\nportraits of Guru Nanak had sandalwood and kum kum Tilaks on his forehead, &nbsp;with a 108 bead Hindu Rudraksha mala around\nhis neck. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All these painting were destroyed and newer paintings of Guru Nanak generated\nby the Tat Singh Sabhias, portray him as&nbsp;\na Muslim sufi saints, like the &nbsp;Arabs from the Biblical stories of Jesus.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\"><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">Every Sikh knew &nbsp;that the glorious Sikh empire of Ranjit Singh\nwas snatched away by the white man and Maharaja Duleep Singh, the&nbsp;</span></span><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">descendant</span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;of Maharaja\nRanjit Singh had been converted to Christianity and taken away to England after\nsnatching away the Kohinoor diamond . &nbsp;</span></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All knew that each of the ten Gurus were in fact from\nHindu families and lived as Hindus until their final days- except Guru Gobind\nSingh who started Sikhism..and this Guru trusted only a Hindu Banda Bahadur to take over his mantle .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A fortnight ago there\nwere landslides and floods at Kedanath , Uttarakhand . At this time our\ncricketer Harbhajan Singh was on his way to Hemkhund Sabib&nbsp; nearby Kedarnath temple at Chamoli district.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-IOuQ_N8JqRY/UdrsG10Du0I/AAAAAAAAkCk/dIlQDu9hJOw/s1600/hemkund.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"478\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-IOuQ_N8JqRY/UdrsG10Du0I/AAAAAAAAkCk/dIlQDu9hJOw/s640/hemkund.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Originally this was a Durga Mandir, later converted to be a Gurudwara .</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is a natural sarovar lake with crystal clear water at a height of 15,200\nfeet .&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Guru Gobind Singh was a\ndevout bhakt of Hindu Goddess Durga. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">This\nfact is mentioned throughout all Sikh historic texts of how he performed the\nMahaChandi yagya at NainaDevi with help of Brahmin priests before setting off\nfor battle.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n\n\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;In his auto biography the 10th Guru writes--<i><o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hemkund\nparbat hai jahan, sapt sring sobhat hai tahan, Vaha hum anik tapasya sadhi,\nMahakal Kalka aaradhi.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In my previous life, I\ndid lot of penance ( as a Rishi ) at Hemkund, and worshipped the primordial\nMother&nbsp;(Mahakal Kalka).&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-bkvU8mieL1I/UdrsSMA9SFI/AAAAAAAAkCo/f1XqWfM8T7M/s1600/hs-2013-3.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-bkvU8mieL1I/UdrsSMA9SFI/AAAAAAAAkCo/f1XqWfM8T7M/s640/hs-2013-3.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is a pilgrimage centre though Sikhism does NOT allow pilgrimages. There\nis a Lakshman Temple closeby.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-7t6B2tQDcaI/Udrsu8DY2RI/AAAAAAAAkC4/2GL8w4f6Wcg/s1600/download.jpggfyvfub.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"242\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-7t6B2tQDcaI/Udrsu8DY2RI/AAAAAAAAkC4/2GL8w4f6Wcg/s400/download.jpggfyvfub.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This Gurudwara Sri\nHemkunt Sahib &nbsp;is devoted to Guru Gobind\nSingh and it find finds mention in Dasam Granth. &nbsp;Hindus go there more than Sikhs. King Pandu,\nthe father of the Pandavas used to do Yoga on the lake bank 6000 year ago. . &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-LoEWsqchaes/UdrslagDR7I/AAAAAAAAkCw/-Egd1eemRFo/s1600/hemkund-sahib-2986006.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"340\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-LoEWsqchaes/UdrslagDR7I/AAAAAAAAkCw/-Egd1eemRFo/s640/hemkund-sahib-2986006.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is written in the Dasham Granth too.&nbsp; Hemkund is inaccessible from October through\nApril because of snow bound paths and glaciers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After the death of\nBanda Singh Muslims rose in power again. &nbsp;Mughal invader, Ahmad Shah Abdali, the founder\nof the Durrani Empire andthe founder of the modern state of Afghanistan demolished\nHarmandir sahib of the Golden temple twice. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Both\nthe times he slaughtered may cows in the sacred pool and the water was blood\nred. &nbsp;Ahmed Shah Abdali even kept a Randi\nka Mandi there- &nbsp;dancing girls.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-QFjh2G6YLD4/Udr3yhzMy-I/AAAAAAAAkDI/ljD_kziW2jg/s1600/760px-Golden_temple_pano.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-QFjh2G6YLD4/Udr3yhzMy-I/AAAAAAAAkDI/ljD_kziW2jg/s640/760px-Golden_temple_pano.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Both the time Hindus\nand Sikhs ralled together to defend the temple. . It was the Hindus who rebuilt\nthe temple everytime, as the Sikh skilled worker , population of the area was\nvery little. Baling out of the sarovar water was a joint effort. The Sikhs have\nforgotten all this. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The golden temple\nwas originally built in 1574. The land for the site was acquired free from\nHindu Zamindars. &nbsp;Thr original idol\ninstalled in this temple was that of Lord Vishnu ( Hari Mandir ) and then Devi\nMata Durga and Lord Shiva &nbsp;\u2013later broken\nand thrown out by the Tat Sikhs of the Sundri faction.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-M-SxiWc9W-U/Udr35GGHgLI/AAAAAAAAkDQ/ih4Wy_7DoNA/s1600/Golden_Temple,_Amritsar_2013-05-21_01-35.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-M-SxiWc9W-U/Udr35GGHgLI/AAAAAAAAkDQ/ih4Wy_7DoNA/s400/Golden_Temple,_Amritsar_2013-05-21_01-35.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The original name of\nAmriit Sarovar was Vishnu Kund. The Vishnu Purana describes how during the\nSatyug era, emperor Ikshwaku performed a Mahayagya in order to propitiate Lord\nHari. The area from then on became to be known as Yagyasthan or a place of\nausterities. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The first Guru Nanak used to sit\nhere feeling the good vibes to meditate along with the Hindu saints of the time\nunder a huge Dukh Bhanjani tree. The city of Amritsar dates back to the Satyug\nEra of Emperor Ikshwaku.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The British propaganda\nis that Emperor Akbar, gave the land for Golden temple as a wedding gift to Bibi\nBhani, a daughter of the third Guru Amar Das, &nbsp;when she married a Hindu Khatri Jetha who\nlater became the 4<sup>th</sup> &nbsp;Guru Ram\nDas . The myth of the foundation stone for Hari Mandir being laid by a Muslim\nsufi Mian Mir is also another immoral fabrication of the British .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b>The Sikh god of\nWaheguru is exactly, repeat, &nbsp;EXACTLY THE SAME as BrahmAn of Hindusim. &nbsp;</b></span></span><b style=\"color: purple; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: x-large; line-height: 150%;\">It is shapeless,\ntimeless, and sightless.</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punch into Google\nsearch- &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>ADVAITA VEDANTA\nPHILOSOPHY &nbsp;SANATANA DHARMA VADAKAYIL</b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Dasam Granth is a\nscripture of Sikhs which contains texts attributed to the Tenth Guru Gobind\nSingh. The Dasam Granth holds a significance of great amount for Sikhs, however\nit does not have the same authority as Adi Granth. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some compositions of\nthe Dasam Granth like Jaap Sahib, (Amrit Savaiye), and Benti Chaupai are part\nof the daily prayers/lessons (Nitnem) of/for Sikhs. Since Guru Gobind Singh was\na Goddess Durga bhakt , the wars of Durga with demons, (Chandi Chritras: Chandi\nChritra I, Chandi Chritra II, Chandi di Var) were written to instill the spirit\nof war among Sikhs.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Takht Sachkhand Shri\nHazur Abchalnagar Sahib and also known as Abchal Nagar, is located on the banks\nof the River Godavari at the city of Nanded, in the state of Maharashtra.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-fuUaaYdlKeI/UdsD0f1b4HI/AAAAAAAAkDo/Jkb2apeRHB0/s1600/Nanded-Photos-Takhat-Sachkhand-Sri-Hazoor-Sahib-Nanded-9688-2-jpg-destreviewimages-500x375-1324605366.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-fuUaaYdlKeI/UdsD0f1b4HI/AAAAAAAAkDo/Jkb2apeRHB0/s640/Nanded-Photos-Takhat-Sachkhand-Sri-Hazoor-Sahib-Nanded-9688-2-jpg-destreviewimages-500x375-1324605366.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is\nwhere the &nbsp;Guru Gobind Singh is said to\nhave passed away. The construction of the gurdwara was done from 1832 to 1837\nby order of Maharaja Ranjit Singh. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-BXCaxB8vikk/UdsDpIUi7nI/AAAAAAAAkDg/64LWEcvuNc0/s1600/photo1.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"432\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-BXCaxB8vikk/UdsDpIUi7nI/AAAAAAAAkDg/64LWEcvuNc0/s640/photo1.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There\nis also a &nbsp;Gurdwara called Baba Banda\nBahadur Ghat at Nanded.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Guru Nanak cast off the\ncostume of a saint , and spent the last 18 years of his life as a householder\nat Kartarpur off-Ravi river.</span> <o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Guru Hargobind gained\nhis freedom, after an incarceration of about seven years (1613- 1620) &nbsp;at Gwalior fort ( NOT 3 years as told by Sikhs\n) . &nbsp;Emperor Jahangir makes no mention at\nall of Guru Hargobind in his memoirs</span> &nbsp;.<o:p></o:p><br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-FU0uSyPLk8A/UdvnOPR4TgI/AAAAAAAAkGs/VIvyeAZWGN4/s1600/images.jpghgdhcj.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"301\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-FU0uSyPLk8A/UdvnOPR4TgI/AAAAAAAAkGs/VIvyeAZWGN4/s400/images.jpghgdhcj.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The days of Baisakhi (\ncoincides with Vishu of Kerala ) and Diwali which are chosen for Sikh festivals\n, are also Hindu festivals all over India. &nbsp;However today Sikhs have converted these two\ndays as related to their Gurus. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Baisakhi is the day on\nwhich the Khalsa was born and Guru Gobind &nbsp;Singh who baptized the first 5 Sikhs using\nsweet nectar Amrit. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And for Diwali the Sikhs\ncelebrate the release of Guru Hargobind from Jehangir\u2019s prison in Gwalior fort.\n&nbsp;They are sure of the day \u2014BUT not at all\nsure how many years he was in jail\u2014 paradox.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Ff7oU6vydz4/UdsR2q6JxJI/AAAAAAAAkD4/qKXQfTcUOjM/s1600/1.The-Fort-of-Gwalior.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"424\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Ff7oU6vydz4/UdsR2q6JxJI/AAAAAAAAkD4/qKXQfTcUOjM/s640/1.The-Fort-of-Gwalior.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><i><span style=\"color: red;\">Above : Gwalior fort.</span></i></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A religion is known by\nits festivals. &nbsp;All the ten Gurus,\nthemselves Khatris, married Hindu Khatri wives.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Khatris are\nVaishyas mercantile community, who originated in Punjab . The Khatris are among\nthe very few non-Brahmin communities that have traditionally studied the Vedas.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During the British rule\nof the 19th century, the Khatri virtually had a monopoly over trade in Punjab ,Pakistan\nand Afghanistan. In Punjab, Haryana and Jammu and Kashmir, Punjabi, is their\nfirst language of the Khatris and the Gurumukhi script is used to write it. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Guru Govind Singhwho\nwas named after Lord Krishna ( Govinda ) created &nbsp;the Khalsa, solely in order to defend \u201cHindu\ndharma\u201d and his mother land. &nbsp;So what happened\nin 1857\u2014 a Sundri group by the name of tat Khalsa just hijacked the &nbsp;Guru\u2019s vision and saved the Christian white\ninvader when the whole of India rose like one to drive them away?<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-ucLRQY07he0/UdvnDpfFK6I/AAAAAAAAkGk/8ZYZE_9omMc/s1600/preview_html_m45e71c02.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"307\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-ucLRQY07he0/UdvnDpfFK6I/AAAAAAAAkGk/8ZYZE_9omMc/s400/preview_html_m45e71c02.gif\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With the connivance of\nthe FAKE white historians holiest shrine, the Sanskrit name Hari Mandir (\nVishnu temple ) &nbsp;was replaced with the\nUrdu name Darbar Sahib (\u201crevered court-session\u201d). &nbsp;An Islamic fatwa became the Sikh hukumnama\n(\u201ccommand-letter\u201d). &nbsp;&nbsp;The Vishnu statue in the Hari Mandir were broken,\nand thrown away which none of the 10 gurus did NOT dare to do.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">It was the German Jew a\nstooge of German Jew&nbsp; Rothschild, the &nbsp;Principal of Government College at Lahore Gottlieb\nWilhelm Leitner who coined the name Singh Sabha and gave all the Urdu titles\nusing a &nbsp;Urdu Muslim scholar, Maulvi\nKarim-ud-Din. &nbsp;Our Jewish man Leitner used to\ndress up as a Sikh.</span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; They were expected to fight\nlike lions . &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Can any hardcore Sikh\nsay today that the sect founded by the 10</span><sup style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\">th</sup><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"> Guru Gobind Singh was\nbased on birth? &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Did Sikhism exist before the Guru Gobind\nSingh? &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This sect was never &nbsp;based on birth but which drew its recruits\nfrom those who were not Khalsa by birth. font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A hush fell over the\nassembly assembled on Baisaki day of 1699 AD at</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Guru again asked for another head, this\ntime Dharam Singh, a Chamar from Hastinapur, presented himself to the Guru. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
