, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Tat Khalsa with\nBritish connivance have even fudged the places of birth of these five Pyares\u2014 and converted them all into Guru worshipping Sikhs from Punjab.</span> &nbsp;&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Daya Ram of Dall , Dharam Das, of Jatwara,\n&nbsp;Sahib Chand of &nbsp;Nangal , Himmat Chand of Sangatpurat and\nMohkam Chand Chhimba, of Ambala. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">Is Orissa, Gujarat , Karnataka etc &nbsp;NOT good enough -- only Punjab is good enough ?</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-xUo3lMmxjTk/Uduoiom_5QI/AAAAAAAAkFE/kDGltF9tZI0/s1600/images.jpgfewre.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"148\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-xUo3lMmxjTk/Uduoiom_5QI/AAAAAAAAkFE/kDGltF9tZI0/s400/images.jpgfewre.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">The woman in the\npicture is Guru Nanak\u2019s first wife &nbsp;Mata\nJitoji, who bore him three sons &nbsp;Jujhar\nSingh, Zorawar Singh and Fateh Singh. &nbsp;&nbsp;It\nis &nbsp;NOT &nbsp;2<sup>nd</sup> wife Sundri &nbsp;( British and Tat Khalsa heroine ) who later\nadopted a son Ajit Singh , who even tried to become the 11<sup>th</sup> Guru-- &nbsp;Mata Jito mixed sugar in water to make amrit.</span></b></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jito Ji was a Khatri\nHindu and her father Hari Jas was from Lahore.&nbsp;\nShe was married to Gobind Rai ( 10<sup>th</sup> Guru ) within a year , after\nhe &nbsp;succeeded his father as the tenth\nguru. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since Guru Gobind Singh\nwas too young and could NOT travel to Lahore ( Guru &nbsp;Tegh Bahadur has just been murdered &nbsp;) his uncle Kirpal Chand arranged for a\nmassive &nbsp;pandal &nbsp;at Anandpur on June 21, 1677 A.D.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After seven years of\nmarriage without children, Mata Jito ji's husband Guru Gobind Rai married again\nbecause his mother &nbsp;Mata Gujri, forced\nhim. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He then married &nbsp;Sundari Swaroop, the daughter of Hindu Ram Saran and Siv Devi of\nBavjara, on 6th April &nbsp;1684 A.D. &nbsp;She could NOT conceive and adoped a son Ajit\nSingh. She was very beautiful outlived Guru Gobind Singh by 40 years.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1690 A.D., after\nnearly 13 years of marriage, the child bride of 10 years , Mata Jito ji became pregnant and all very happy .\nShe gave birth to her first son Jujhar Singh in 1691 A.D. &nbsp;Then she bore Zorawar Singh on November 17,\n1696 A.D. The youngest son Fateh Singh born on February 25, 1699 A.D.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Never mind what the\nFAKE British historians say. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Guru Gobind\nSingh loved Mata Jito Ji. &nbsp;A few weeks after\nthe birth of his youngest son, Fateh Singh , the tenth guru established the\nKhalsa order on April 14th during the Vaisakhi spring festival of 1699. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even this day and month\nhas been fudged by the British to make Sikhism separate from Hindusim as 30\nMarch 1699 AD . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Today the Sikhs\ncelebrate Baisakhi on 13<sup>th</sup> April. &nbsp;In Kerala Vishu is on 14<sup>th</sup> April .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1984, the\nKhalistanis wrote all over the Internet and fudged records that &nbsp;two women were &nbsp;one.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I challenge anybody to\nshow a Sikh historical record before 1800 AD that the two wives are actually\none. Please excuse me from Khalistani &nbsp;books after 1980 AD and Tat Khalsa books after\n1900 AD. &nbsp;The Mahan Kosh, &nbsp;Twareekh Guru Khalsa, &nbsp;Guru Padd Prem Parkash all say both are\ndifferent women. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>Some wisdom: &nbsp;No Sikh present or future can EVER NEVER EVER\nNEVER &nbsp;be &nbsp;the Sikh Guru-- &nbsp;so please take it easy when fudging historical\nfacts.</b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">A very religious and a gentleman\nSikh Chief Engineer had </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">sailed with me. He\nused to play Gurbani loudly throughout the day and this used to irritate me ,\nas it affected my work . But I let it be. His beard almost touches his knees .\nHe had told me that a 3rd alliance from Rohtas was brought to him. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Guru Gobind Singh asked Mata Sahib Kaur ( born 1st Nov 1681 ) &nbsp;to\nstay and do seva for the panth . </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">At that\ntime her father Bhai Ramu a</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">nd mother Jasdevi\nBassi&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">queried </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">that if she does\nseva for the panth , then what about giving birth to children . </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">In reply Guru Gobind Singh replied that she\nwill have millions of children and she would be the mother of Khalsa.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-3zkWGjzbyNA/Udu19lbEnsI/AAAAAAAAkFU/aHkYx-tu0zY/s1600/1801.jpgd3r.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-3zkWGjzbyNA/Udu19lbEnsI/AAAAAAAAkFU/aHkYx-tu0zY/s640/1801.jpgd3r.jpg\" width=\"444\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is\na Gurudwara in Rohtas (district Jhelum, Pakistan)-- &nbsp;see above picture-- which was repaired by Maharaja Ranjit Singh, but is now in very poor condition. Sikhs go there for pilgrimage even today. If this is true , Sikhs must get it repaired. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-WW5OmwQHZaI/Udu2-hNjHqI/AAAAAAAAkFk/YBKZcxLPFD8/s1600/vaisakhi-b.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-WW5OmwQHZaI/Udu2-hNjHqI/AAAAAAAAkFk/YBKZcxLPFD8/s640/vaisakhi-b.jpg\" width=\"185\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">For Mata Sahib Kaur is the&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">mother of Khalsa \u2013 the honourable Sri maan Mata of Guru Khalsa Panth..&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;I do NOT expect my old Chief Engineer to lie. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">He said Mata Sahib Devi\nstayed </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">in the apartments of the Guru\nGobind Singh\u2019s </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">mother, Mata Gujri. &nbsp; &nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-UXjBlsJPrRQ/Udu5WSo4UnI/AAAAAAAAkF0/_ZuGzeMMvFQ/s1600/Mata+Jito+Ji+pouring+Pataasay+into+Amrit.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"305\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-UXjBlsJPrRQ/Udu5WSo4UnI/AAAAAAAAkF0/_ZuGzeMMvFQ/s400/Mata+Jito+Ji+pouring+Pataasay+into+Amrit.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">He was 100% clear that\nit was Mata Jito ji </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">who poured the\npatashas in the Amrit for the Panj Pyares-- NOT Mata Sundri or Mata Sahib KKaur..&nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gurudwara Nankana Sahib\n, at the &nbsp;birthplace of Guru Nanak Dev , is\nlocated about 80 kilometers south west of Lahore . &nbsp;This was made in 1600 AD and &nbsp;renovated in the years 1819 AD by Maharaja\nJassa Singh Ramgarhia.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In July 1925, The\nBrtish and Tat Khalsa managed &nbsp;Shiromani\nGurdwara Prabandhak Committee (\u201cCommittee of Shrine Management\u201d), &nbsp;removed the Hindu idols and evicted the traditional\npujaris / mahants (guardians , accusing them of theft. &nbsp;&nbsp;British\ngovernor, Sir Malcolm Hailey, set up Tat Khalsa &nbsp;elected central Sikh board, &nbsp;and new Silh mahants he said represented the\ntrue Sikh community. &nbsp;Sikh shrines and\nmahants were placed under the board\u2019s control.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sir Malcom Hailey used Master\nTara Singh , a British loyalist in all these activities . &nbsp;He later demanded &nbsp;for a Sikh-majority state in Punjab, India.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tara Singh was born a\nHindu and can be considered as the ORIGINAL mentor of Khalistanis . Upon\ngraduation from Khalsa College at Amritsar in 1907, he entered the Sikh school\nsystem in Lyallpur, becoming a Gyani &nbsp;or\n\u201cmaster,\u201d a title associated with him thereafter.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1961 Tara Singh\ndeclared that he would fast until the Indian prime minister, Jawaharlal Nehru,\nceded a portion of the Punjab as a Sikh state or until death claimed him. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He began his fast in\nAugust at the Golden Temple at Amritsar, but Nehru responded that submission to\nTara Singh\u2019s demands would be against India\u2019s secular constitution and unfair\nto the Hindus in the Punjab. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-zcPLzniSVB4/Udu-bBTwMlI/AAAAAAAAkGE/Ae3_NEnI8hE/s1600/images.jpgygtib.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-zcPLzniSVB4/Udu-bBTwMlI/AAAAAAAAkGE/Ae3_NEnI8hE/s400/images.jpgygtib.jpg\" width=\"273\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After a personal letter\nfrom Nehru promising to investigate Sikh claims, Tara Singh broke his 48-day\nfast, incurring the wrath of the Sikh people. Tara Singh was brought to trial\nbefore a council of pijaras (Sikh religious leaders) and pleaded guilty. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">His failure to starve\nto death in defense of his ideals had discredited him as a leader, and Sant\nFateh Singh was elected in his place. Tara Singh\u2019s dream of a Punjabi-speaking\nstate was realized in 1966, when the present Indian state of Punjab was\ncreated.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Just in case you guys\nthink that the British continuously made an ass of the entire Sikh Community--\nhere is something you must know. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">You will NOT find this\nanywhere else. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">So listen up.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">THE DEAL THE BRITISH\nMADE WITH SIKHS WERE QUID PRO QUO. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">YOU&nbsp;</span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">SCRATCH</span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;OUR BACKSIDES\n&nbsp;AND WE SCRATCH YOURS.<o:p></o:p></span></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">An elaborate plan was\nmade to show the Sikhs that they would be the new Brahmans of Punjab. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">They would hold the\npower .<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">They would hold the good\nfertlile lands and the money.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">Sikhs were told to buy\nup land at certain areas cheap throw away prices . </span></b><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-yPxc3iqgKrQ/UdxQzqzR4cI/AAAAAAAAkIE/zT5I1ylJ56k/s1600/DWDF.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">These lands were\nliterally deserts. Nothing was ever gown there. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">The Hindus and Muslim\nwere wondering why the Sikhs are buying all these lands.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Soon came the stunning\nnews. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Yeah--pretty much the\nway <i>apna desh ka daamad </i>Robert\nWadhera --nay--Vadra did recently.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Take out your maps and\ncheck this out . <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">You can make a trip to\nthe municipality or corporation to dig out the dates from old records if they\nexist. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">The&nbsp; desert lands to the west of Punjab were made\ncultivable by&nbsp; canals and were allotted\nonly to Sikhs residing in eastern Punjab at throw away prices. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Check out the huge and\nvast tract of land known as 'Nilibar' irrigated by the Chenab Canal.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Check out the Nuevo rich\nSikh farm owners cum farmers in the districts of Amritsar, Ludhiana, Ferozepur\nand adjoining areas. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>The most loyal stooges\nof the British got the canal zone lands free. &nbsp;Tracts of land from 15 acres to 500 acres were\ndoled out.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Canal networks&nbsp; were dug at Upper Bari Doab, from river Ravi\nand lower Bari Doab as well from that River; the upper Chenab canal from Chenab\nriver. The Shahpur Thal desert was irrigated by the canals taken from river\nJhelum in upper Jhelum canal.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">These irrigation\nprojects covered entire lands which were previously arid deserts where not a\nblade of grass grew.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">These lands were made fit for agriculture from the Chenab\nriver, 430 miles of canal were dug with&nbsp; 2293\nmiles of distributor channels, while 12,100 miles of the water course were\ntaken. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">Financial incentives\nwere given to the most loyal British Sikh stooges. </span></b><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Recommendations from\nloyal Sikh Maharajas were acquiesced to. &nbsp;Now you know the secrets of 15 gun and 21 gun\nsalutes and how Sikh Maharajas were found fit to visit king George in England. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">These channels\nirrigated 2.6 million acres of land. &nbsp;It\nwas at the cost of 350 Lakh rupees ( a fortune in those days ) and the initial yearly\nvalue of the crop yielded over 900 lakh rupees -- every paise earned by the\nloyal Sikh farmers. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Posts for loyal Sikhs\nwere reserved in the Army and in the civil services to be filled exclusively by\nbaptized Sikhs, the Tat Khalsa. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">The land owning\nBrahmins now depended on Sikhs who became the new Zamindars.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">The Sikhs held the\nmoney, &nbsp;they were allowed to carry swords\n, they got the ear of Rothschild -&nbsp; &nbsp;they were the new tough guys on the block .<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Meanwhile the Christian\nmissionaries converted 4 Sikh youth and all hell broke loose. The Christian missionaries\nwere literally bambooed , and told to lay off from the Sikh community\nby Rothschild.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Why do you think there\nare so many anti- Hindu Khalistanis in Canada . <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>In 1897, Queen Victoria\ninvited her most loyal Sikh Soldiers&nbsp; to\nattend her Diamond Jubilee celebrations in London. <o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">These loyal badge Sikh\nsoldiers, were then taken on a conducted tour of Canada on their way hom</span></b>e. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">They were promised\nlarge tracts of free land if they immigrate--as a reward for their loyalty. </span>&nbsp;&nbsp;</b><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">They were told to go\nback to their villages and spread the good world quietly among Sikhs only. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">It is another thing\nthat the first batch of Sikhs who went there had eye infection ( trachoma ) and\nafter that they made a new rule that the trip from originate from India by\nship.. Which meant a good incubation period for any disease --and only healthy\nSikhs would land up after a health check . <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">These Sikhs returned to\nIndia with stories of an attractive land of milk and honey waiting to be\nsettled by British loyalist subjects. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">By 1907, when the\nKhalsa Diwan society was organized in Vancouver with branches in Abbotsford,\nNew Westminster, Fraser Mills, Duncan Coombs and Ocean Falls. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Sikhs were given\nemployment with good salary in laying the tracks of the Canadian Pacific\nRailway, in lumber mills and mines. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Though they earned marginally&nbsp; less than white workers, they made more than\nenough money to send to India and get relatives to immigrate to Canada nay\nKENEEDAAA. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Today Canadian Sikhs\nwho hate India are more than 2.02 % of the total population.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Can you believe this\n?&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">In late 1919, the British\ngovernment got their loyal Sikh stooges to present a Saropa (Robe of Honour)</span><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"> to&nbsp;</span></b></span></span><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">Lieutenant Governor\nof the Punjab , Sir Francis O'Dwyer who endorsed </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">General Reginald Dyer's action regarding the\nJallianwala Bagh massacre and termed it a \"correct action\u2014he was later assassinated\nby Udham Singh.</span></b></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maharani\nJindan Kaur\u2019s &nbsp;lover ( the biological\nfather of Maharaja Duleep Singh ) &nbsp;Lal\nSingh and PM Gulab Singh did NOT see eye to eye. &nbsp;She kept needlessly interfering in political affairs.\n&nbsp;She dismissed PM &nbsp;Gulab Singh and made<b><span style=\"color: red;\"> her lover Lal Singh</span></b> the\nPrime Minister on 26 February, 1847.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: large;\">OK, some examples to whet your appetite?</span></i><br />\n<i><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></i>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\">When the Khatris,\nAhluwalia\u2019s , Aroras etc heard about the land bounty for Sikhs , there was a mad\nscramble again to CONVERT their first born sons into Sikhs. &nbsp;&nbsp;Rest of\nthe sons were called Monas &nbsp;.</span></i></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></i></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\">Rothschild&nbsp;\nfavoured Sunder Singh Lyallpuri of the Sikh Reform Movement .&nbsp; A lot was written how much the British hated\nhim ( all bull ) .&nbsp; He was directly\nresponsible for the Anand Marriage Act, where if you are NOT a 5K Sikh you\ncannot marry by the Anand Karaj ceremony.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\">For giving good\nco-operation his father Lakmir S Sandha was given free and canal&nbsp; irrigated fertile lands&nbsp; in the new Bar Chenab colony (Faisalabad ).&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\">But equations changed\nafter the Jallianwala Bagh Massacre of 13 April 1919, and the British took back\nthe donated lands and jailed Lyallpuri .&nbsp;&nbsp;\n.&nbsp;</span></i><span style=\"font-size: small;\">&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\">Till Hindu Banda came on the scene as a leader the tactics were HIT AND RUN, &nbsp;KACHA UDHAKE . &nbsp; &nbsp;For banda it was DUSHMAN KA GHAR KE ANDAR GHUSKE MAARO.</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\">The first born were\ntold by their greedy parents to put a cloth ball on top of their the heads to look like a tied up hair bun, &nbsp;tie a turban and growa beard -- and added Singh to their names . &nbsp;&nbsp;They\nalso joined the free British zamin aur maal party.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\">Initially at the time\nof Guru Nanak , Singh meant devotee . &nbsp;&nbsp;There was NO lion meaning till Guru Gobind\nSingh alluded to it.&nbsp; &nbsp;Only later it became synonymous to lion.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\">15026 names of Gods\nappeared in the original Adi Granth. &nbsp;Out of this Hari or Vishnu was &nbsp;mentioned 8009 times and Lord Rama 2531 times..<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\">Master Tara Singh was\nthe founder of Vishwa Hindu Parishad-- so what is this man all about ? Is he nuts?? .<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-weight: bold;\">VANDE MATARAM &nbsp;-</span><span style=\"font-size: large;\"> play this video below with headphones .</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is a hymn to the\nMother Land (&nbsp;</span><i><span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: sans-serif; font-size: 13px; line-height: 19.1875px;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: sans-serif; font-size: 13px; line-height: 19.1875px;\">\"I bow to thee, Mother\"</span></i><span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: sans-serif; font-size: 13px; line-height: 19.1875px;\"><i>&nbsp;</i>)</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">. &nbsp;Unknown and unsung heroes\nsang this song in public and were sent to Kaala Pani ( overseas Cellular jail at\nAndamans ) by the British rulers .&nbsp; &nbsp;This song &nbsp;played a vital role in the Indian independence\nmovement.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Last month we had a Muslim MP walking away from Parliament when this\nsong was sung. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He is Muslim first and\nthen a Paki. , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0938\u0928\u094d\u0928\u093f\u0939\u093f\u0924\u0947</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0915\u093e\u0932\u0947</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><br />\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0928\u0939\u093f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0928\u0939\u093f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0930\u0915\u094d\u0937\u0924\u093f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0921\u0941\u0915\u0943\u0919\u094d\u0915\u0930\u0923\u0947</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\".\nThen again the part where a saffron clad Adi Sankara says<br />\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u091c\u091f\u093f\u0932\u094b</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u092e\u0941\u0923\u094d\u0921\u0940</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0932\u0941\u091e\u094d\u091b\u093f\u0924\u0915\u0947\u0936\u0903</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><br />\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0915\u093e\u0937\u093e\u092f\u093e\u092e\u094d\u092c\u0930\u092c\u0939\u0941\u0915\u0943\u0924\u0935\u0947\u0937\u0903</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0964</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><br />\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u092a\u0936\u094d\u092f\u0928\u094d\u0928\u092a\u093f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u091a</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0928</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u092a\u0936\u094d\u092f\u0924\u093f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u092e\u0942\u0922\u094b</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><br />\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0939\u094d\u092f\u0941\u0926\u0930\u0928\u093f\u092e\u093f\u0924\u094d\u0924\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u092c\u0939\u0941\u0915\u0943\u0924\u0935\u0947\u0937\u0903</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0967\u096a\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><br />\n<br />\nThere are many who go with matted locks, many who have clean<br />\nshaven heads, many whose hairs have been plucked out; some are<br />\nclothed in orange, yet others in various colours --- all just for<br />\na livelihood.<br />\n<br />\nHow can a saint himself deride saints like this? Even if there are black sheep,\nwill he write a verse deriding all sadhus?<br />\n<br />\nAgain in Hanuman Chalisa - even when reading it aloud, I could not get myself\nto say these lines -<br />\n<br />\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0914\u0930</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0926\u0947\u0935\u0924\u093e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u091a\u093f\u0924\u094d\u0924</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0928</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0927\u0930\u0908</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0964</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><br />\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0939\u0928\u0941\u092e\u0924</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0938\u0947\u0907</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0938\u0930\u094d\u092c</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0938\u0941\u0916</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0915\u0930\u0908</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0965\u0969\u096b\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><br />\n<br />\nI will not keep any other God in my heart, except Hanuman.<br />\nSo I will not even remember Ram/Vishnu (even though Hanuman himself worships\nRam)?<br />\n<br />\nThis never felt right.<br />\n<br />\nAs soon as Ajit ji wrote this, it was a Eureka moment.<br />\n<br />\nMany thanks, Ajit ji.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: normal; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0964</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> chh\u016btahi bandi mah\u0101 sukha ho\u012b</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> 38 </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><br />\n<br />\nOne who recites Hanuman Chalisa a hundred times (or for hundred days) is\nreleased from bondage ( MOKSHA ) and obtains great bliss\". BALLS !<br />\n<br />\njo yaha parhai hanum\u0101na ch\u0101l\u012bs\u0101</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0964</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> hoya siddha s\u0101kh\u012b gaur\u012bs\u0101</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> 39 </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><br />\n<br />\nOne who reads this Hanuman Chalisa obtains Siddhi (accomplishment or\nliberation). Shiva himself bears witness to this statement-- BALLS !<br />\n<br />\ntulas\u012bd\u0101sa sad\u0101 hari cher\u0101</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0964</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> k\u012bjai n\u0101tha hridaya maha der\u0101</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> 40 </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><br />\n<br />\nTulsidas is always a devotee of Hari. O Lord, make my heart your abode.<br />\n-- CHOOT TULSIDAS NEVER EXISTED<br />\n<br />\npavantanaya sankata harana mangala m\u016brati r\u016bpa</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0964</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> r\u0101ma lakhan s\u012bt\u0101 sahita hridaya basahu sura bh\u016bpa</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><br />\n<br />\nO Son of V\u0101yu, remover of adversities, one with an auspicious form, and the\nchief among all Devas, may you reside in our hearts along with Rama, Lakshman\nand Sita-- BALLS HANUMAN IS CHIEF AMONG DEVAS--HE IS JUST A MONKEY IN RAMAYANA.\nRAMA IS THE GOD.. WE HAVE RAMA IDOLS IN TEMPLES<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0Gvy5mBcipE/WlAJZNfU3zI/AAAAAAABXsU/wZaBJr4cOoclmnshY0dz6Y3NbokDpLaaACK4BGAYYCw/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c7408015507702308046\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_149M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Maharaja Kharak Singh, (Elder son of Maharaja Ranjit Singh)<br />\nBirth February 20, 1801, Accession June 27, 1839<br />\nDeposed in a coup October 8, 1839, Poisoned to death November 5, 1840<br />\n<br />\n2. Maharaja Sher Singh., (Second son of Maharaja Ranjit Singh)<br />\nOccupied the throne November 9, 1840, for 23 days only, Dethroned December 2, 1840<br />\n<br />\n4. Maharani Chand Kaur ., (Widow of Maharaja Kharak Singh)<br />\nProclaimed Malika Mukaddas December 2, 1840 or Queen Empress.<br />\nCapituated January 17, 1841, Deposed January 18, 1841, Killed June 9, 1842<br />\n<br />\n5. Maharaia Sher Singh, ( son of Ranjit Singh with Mehtab Kaur , Again returned to power)<br />\nBirth 1807<br />\nAccession January 18, 1841, Killed September 15, 1843<br />\n<br />\n6. However, some women escaped and took shelter in Brahmin (highest priestly caste) houses. The Brahmin declared them to be Brahmin and even ate with them in order to show Parashurama that the Kshatriya women were from their caste, and thus saved them. According to this story, the children born of these women became the Khatri. UNQUOTE<br />\n<br />\nIn Punjab (where they are largely concentrated in the districts of Amritsar, Jalandhar, Ludhiana, Gurdaspur, and Patiala), the Khatri have four subgroups, namely, Bahri, Bunjahi, Sariu and Khokhrar, which are further divided into a large number of clans.<br />\n<br />\nLIKE IS SAID-- SIKHS ARE NOT READY FOR ANY FURTHER REVELATIONS .<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/07/unknown-history-of-sikhs-and-sikhism.html</span><br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_154B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; WE NEVER HEARD OF CHITRAGUPTA ( AND MISSING LINK KAYASTHAS ) TILL THE WHITE INVADER CAME TO INDIA..<br />\n<br />\nIN SANATANA DHARMA HEAVEN IS THE SEVENTH ASTRAL LAYER ( BRAHMAN THE FIELD ) WHO SHEARED OFF A SMALL BIT OF HIS BODY AND SEND YOU AS A SOUL ( BALL OF ENERGY ) AT ITS LOWEST FREQUENCY TO GAIN LIFE EXPERIENCE..<br />\n<br />\nYOU ( YOUR SOUL EVOLVED ) FROM BACTERIA, TO BIRD, TO ANIMAL TO HUMAN WITH LOW FREQUENCY SOULD TO MOKSHA SOUL OF HIGHEST FREQUENCY , SAME AS BRAHMAN --AFTER WHICH YOUR SOUL MERGED BACK WITH MOTHER FIELD OF BRAHMAN TO SHARE LIFE EXPERIENCES WITH ITS MOTHER ..<br />\n<br />\nWHEN THE FEED BACK STOPS IN THIS CLOSED LOOP --PRALAYA ( DISSOLUTION ) HAPPENS ..<br />\n<br />\nFIRST ASTRAL LATER IS MEANT FOR ALL SPECIES OF LIVES --EXCEPT HUMAN .. THE SOULS OF CRIMINALS/ HOMOSEXUALS WHO HAVE NO CONSCIENCE ARE IN THE LAYER..<br />\n<br />\nSECOND TO SIXTH LAYERS ARE MEANT ONLY FOR CONSCIOUS HUMANS..<br />\n<br />\nTHE SECOND ASTRAL LAYER MEANT FOR SOULS WITH LOWEST FREQUENCY ( HIGH NEGATIVE KARMIC BAGGAGE ) AND THE SIXTH ASTRAL HAVING PARKING SPACE FOR SOULS OF HIGHER FREQUENCY ( LOW NEGATIVE KARMIC BAGGAGE ).<br />\n<br />\nYAMA IS IN CHARGE OF LAYERS TWO TO SIX..<br />\n<br />\nALL SOULS IN FIRST TO SIXTH ASTRAL LAYERS --AWAIT RE-BIRTH.<br />\n<br />\nSEVENTH ASTRAL LAYER IS THE FIELD OF BRAHMAN ( VAIKUNTA ).. HERE ONLY MOKSHA SOULS -- NIL EGO, NIL KRAMIC BAGGAGE AND HIGHEST SOULD FREQUENCY ( SAME AS MOTHER FIELD BRAHMAN ) CAN ENTER --TO BE MERGED WITH BRAHMAN ( GOD )..<br />\n<br />\nONLY SOULS CAN ENTER ALL SEVEN ASTRAL LAYERS --NOT THE PHYSICAL BODY ..<br />\n<br />\nTHE RASCAL SADUGU JAGGI VASUDEV LIES ABOUT PLENTY FOOD TO EAT AND APSARAS FOR SEX IN SEVENTH LAYER .. BALLS !<br />\n<br />\nWHEN THE 5 PANDAVA BROTHERS AND DRAUPADI DECIDE TO CLIMB MOUNT MERU --IT IS AN ALLEGORY FOR DEATH AND SOULS PARKING AT ONE OF THE SEVEN ASTRAL LAYERS<br />\n<br />\nYAMA ( DHARMA ) IN THE FORM OF A DOG JOINS THIS GROUP ..<br />\n<br />\nYAMA USHERS IN --<br />\nDRAUPADI INTO THE SECOND ASTRAL LAYER<br />\nNAKULA INTO THE THIRD ASTRAL LAYER<br />\nSAHADEVA INTO THE FOURTH ASTRAL LAYER<br />\nBHIMA INTO THE FIFTH ASTRAL LAYER<br />\nARJUNA INTO THE SIXTH ASTRAL LAYER<br />\n<br />\nAND THEN YUDHISTRA LOOKS BACK AND SEES THE DOG.. HE KNOWS THAT NO DOG CAN GET PAST THE FIRST ASTRAL LAYER --AND HE IS PUZZLED..<br />\n<br />\nAT THE SEVENT ASTRAL LAYER ( EQUIVALENT OF HEAVEN ) YUDDHISTRA SEES ALL HUNDRED KAURAVAS ALREADY THERE -- ALONG WITH THE STALWARTS LIKE BHISHMA/ DRONA /KARNA ETC<br />\n<br />\nHE IS SHOCKED AND ANGRY<br />\n<br />\nAT THAT TIME YAMA ( THE DOORKEEPER OF ASTRAL LAYERS 2 TO 6 ) DECLARES THAT HE IS YUDDHISTRAs FATHER WITH KUNTI .. AND THAT YUDDHISTRA STILL HAS SEEDS OF EGO WITHIN HIMS WHICH MAKES HIM UNFIT FOR MOKSHA ..<br />\n<br />\nYAMAs EXPLANATION: WHOEVER KRISHNA KILLED --ALL GOT MOKSHA .. KRISHNA HAD THE UNWRITTEN TASK OF KILLING ALL 100 TEST TUBE KAURAVA BABIES-- HE DID IT AND HOW..<br />\n<br />\nPANDAVAS WOULD HAVE HAD ALBINO BLOOD OF MOTHER KUNTI HAS SEX WITH PANDU ( AN ALBINO )--AND IN THAT CASE KRISHNA WOULD HAVE KILLED ALL 5 PANDAVAS TOO..<br />\n<br />\nBeautiful and intelligent Queen Kunti was the mother of Karna and the first three Pandava brothers Yudhishthira, Bhima, Arjuna. .<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2--</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_179BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/02/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_18.html?showComment=1519128291766#c4772191711408119887\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">February 20, 2018 at 5:34 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_189MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhttps://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/justin-trudeau-visits-amritsar-tomorrow-given-history-of-city-he-must-tread-wisely/articleshow/62998084.cms<br />\n<br />\nWE WILL NOT TOLERATE A SINGLE WORD FROM CANADIAN PM JUSTIN TRUDEAU ABOUT THE SIKH REFUGEE SHIP KOMAGATA MARU...<br />\n<br />\nJUST BEFORE THE FIRST WORLD WAR, JEW ROTHSCHILD MOVED MANY CRYPTO JEW SIKHS TO CANADA BY SHIP..<br />\n<br />\nTHESE WERE DESCENDANTS OF TRAITOR SIKHS WHO SUPPORTED ROTHSCHILD IN 1857 FIRST WAR OF INDEPENDENCE..<br />\n<br />\nThe Komagata Maru arrived on Canada's West Coast on May 23, 1914, anchoring in Vancouver's Coal Harbour. Nearly all of the 376 passengers were denied entry and the ship sat in the harbour for two months<br />\n<br />\nTHE REASON WAS ALL THE SIKHS HAD A HIGHLY CONTAGIOUS EYE INFECTION TRACHOMA<br />\n<br />\nChlamydia is one of the most common sexually transmitted infections in the west affecting about 6.1% of women and 3.2 of men..<br />\n<br />\nLET US STOP THE BULLSHIT ( BY JEW ROTHSCHILDs MEDIA ) THAT THE SHIPs SIKH PASSENGERS WERE STOPPED DUE TO RACISM..<br />\n<br />\nMore than 350 Sikhs were denied entry to Canada and sent back across the Pacific Ocean \u2014 back to India. It reached Calcutta on 29 September 1914.<br />\n<br />\nSome of the Sikhs died on the way back --these deaths were due to Chlamydia. The ship had enough of food and water<br />\n<br />\nThe Sikh passengers ( certified as traitors) were not allowed to enter Calcutta; they were rather ordered to board a Punjab-bound train especially arranged for the purpose. They refused to do so and many of the passengers were killed, a great many escaped.<br />\n<br />\nThe ship, renamed as Guru Nanak Jahaj, by the Sikh who chartered Komagata Maru-- Baba Gurdit Singh<br />\n<br />\nBaba Gurdit Singh's grandfather Sardar Rattan Singh was a Rothschild agent.<br />\n<br />\nGurdit Singh did NOT belong to Ghadarite party<br />\n<br />\nThe Komagata Maru voyage began in Hong Kong on 4 April 1914 and ended nearly six months later on 29 September at Budge Budge, twenty-seven kilometres downstream from Calcutta..<br />\n<br />\nIn Malaya Gurdit Singh supplied milk to a Sikh regiment, loyal to Jew Rothschild.<br />\n<br />\nSIKHS IN CANADA AND ENGLAND WERE INVITED BY THE QUEEN FOR SUPPORTING THE CROWN DURING THE 1857 FIRST WAR OF INDEPENDENCE --THEY DID NOT GO AS REFUGEES<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/07/unknown-history-of-sikhs-and-sikhism.html<br />\n<br />\nNO NATAK BAAZI FROM JUSTIN BABY ( BIOLOGICAL SON OF CRYPTO JEW FIDEL CASTRO ) -- JUST LAY OFF INDIA !<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; They are indeed the same, just as musk and its scent are inseparable, or as fire and its heat are nondifferent. Thus Radha and Lord Krsna are one, yet They have taken two forms to enjoy the mellows of pastimes. (Cc. Adi 4.96-98)<br />\n<br />\nisvarera sakti haya e-tina prakara<br />\neka laksmi-gana, pure mahisi-gana ara<br />\nvraje gopi-gana ara sabhate pradhana<br />\nvrajendra-nandana ya'te svayam bhagavan<br />\n<br />\nThe energies (consorts) of the Supreme Lord are of three kinds: the Laksmis in Vaikuntha, the queens in Dvaraka, and the gopis in Vrndavana. The gopis are the best of all, for they have the privilege of serving Sri Krsna, the primeval Lord, the son of the King of Vraja (Cc. Adi 1.79,80)<br />\n<br />\nSORRY -- All this bull about Radha being a mistress of Lord Krishna and all his thousands of Gopikas whom he flirted with , are all poisons injected into Hinduism by the white Christian invader. (\u0927\u0943\u092a\u0926)</span><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">\"My anklets that usually jingle in my feet started jingling more as he copulated with me in different conjoining sex postures, and while at it the golden chain in my girdle fell down, while he grasped my hair bun to give a dole of kiss, such as we were, now why don't you make him to take delight in me, when my heart and mind are filled with love for him...</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">\u0930\u0924\u093f \u0938\u0941\u0916 \u0938\u092e\u092f \u0930\u0938\u093e \u0905\u0932\u0938\u092f\u093e, \u0926\u0930 \u092e\u0941\u0915\u0941\u0932\u093f\u0924 \u0928\u092f\u0928 \u0938\u0930\u094b\u091c\u092e\u094d .</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">\u0928\u093f\u0903\u0938\u0939 \u0928\u093f\u092a\u0924\u093f\u0924 \u0924\u0928\u0941 \u0932\u0924\u092f\u093e, \u092e\u0927\u0941\u0938\u0942\u0926\u0928 \u092e\u0941\u0926\u093f\u0924 \u092e\u0928\u094b\u091c\u092e\u094d .. \u096d..</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">\u0938\u0916\u0940 \u0939\u0947 \u0915\u0947\u0936\u092e\u0925\u0928\u092e\u094d \u0909\u0926\u093e\u0930\u092e\u094d ...
