It can also be concrete objects\nsuch as the waters, &nbsp;aakasha ( ether ) or\nthe sun as manifestations of the operation of \u1e5aita in the cosmos.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">India is widely recognized\nat the last place on earth where spirituality still exists. Even the western\nthinkers agree that &nbsp;a chapter which had\na Western beginning will have to have an Indian ending if it is not to end in\nself-destruction of the human race.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At\nthis supremely dangerous moment in human history the only way of salvation for\nthe mankind is an Indian way</span></i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"> \u2013 <b>Arnold Toynbee<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-NPcBlZI60Oc/UdAhCVBzgRI/AAAAAAAAjtM/9ZLttBmyz0Q/s403/549341_425069930911830_1358147136_n.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-NPcBlZI60Oc/UdAhCVBzgRI/AAAAAAAAjtM/9ZLttBmyz0Q/s320/549341_425069930911830_1358147136_n.jpg\" height=\"320\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In times of confusion\nand crisis regarding what is right and what is wrong, one's own conscience is\nthe sole guide. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>\"In times of\ndoubt, O, son of Kunti [Arjuna], one must decide using one's own good sense</i><b><i>\u201d</i>- &nbsp;Bhagawat Gita&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hindus respect and\nappreciate culture in terms of itself. &nbsp;We\nare sensitive to cultural nuances . &nbsp;We\nlisten and we respect local values . &nbsp;We\nunderstand that culture has a life of its own and is stronger than life and\ntriumphs over death. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We believe human\nbeings have feelings unlike machines. In an Indian company employees areseen as\n&nbsp;bread winners at home. &nbsp;Shared ethos has more weight than adherence to\nhard written rules and there is absence of deception.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Divorce rate within\nHindus is the lowest in the world--it is a mindset . Marriage is NOT based on\nlust, but by sacred commitment of 7 pheras around a holy fire. No Hindu woman\nwill go for silicon implants to save her marriage. When a Hindu greets you with\na Namaste, he bows to the greatness in you.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>Patanjali Yoga sutra\n(1.33)</b> -- Mind becomes purified by cultivating feelings of maitri\n( friendliness, lovingness) which is a feeling towards others when others are\nhappy, &nbsp;Karuna ( compassion or mercy)\nfeelings towards others when others are suffering, &nbsp;mudita (gladness or good will) towards where\nthere are good things happening and upeksha (indifference, neutrality or\nacceptance) where there is bad things are happening or bad behavior from other\npeople.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dharma fosters a\nclimate of social and spiritual responsibility. Dharma is not a set of rules\nthat restrict your way of life or cramp your style. Dharma puts things in their\nproper place, allows your perspective and creates and maintains balance. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the &nbsp;Dharmashastras, dharma is examined from\nvirtually every imaginable angle, &nbsp;every\nperspective , from kingly duties, cultural norms, sexual relations, and\neveryday social rules such as manners and etiquette. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And mind you it is not\nthe ridiculous Emily Post type of snooty etiquette where a genteel lady has to\ncrook her little finger while having tea.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-UFle-2Yx30k/UdBeCsDPLPI/AAAAAAAAjuE/s7pI0PFbZfg/s256/jhytvubp.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-UFle-2Yx30k/UdBeCsDPLPI/AAAAAAAAjuE/s7pI0PFbZfg/s400/jhytvubp.jpg\" height=\"195\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hinduism teaches that\npeople who remain on the path of dharma lead successful, happy lives. &nbsp;It is the secret to divine joy on earth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Today, with emigration\nand globalisation, and the assault of foreign funded TV on our culture, it is\nfar more difficult for Hindus to discern what practices are consistent with\ndharma.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karma is understood in\nHinduism as a universal law of cause and effect. Positive actions produce\npositive effects; negative actions produce negative effects. To act dharmically\nis to act in a karmically positive manner, therefore.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When one acts\ndharmically, one necessarily produces positive karma. This karma is cumulative:\none accrues karma, positive and negative, not only throughout the course of\none's life, but throughout the course of one's multiple rebirths. It is karma\nthat determines one's rebirths. Once your accrued karma log is cleared , on god\u2019s\nsanction alone, you attain moksha, which is the final end to earthly sojourns.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dharma embraces every type of righteous conduct covering every aspect of life\nessential for the sustenance and welfare of the indiavidual and society and\nincludes those rules which guide and enable those to attain moksha (eternal\nbliss).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dharma nourishes our\nsociety and existence. One must carry out their duties without being attached\nto the results of their actions. Hinduism connects metaphysics, ethics, and\nontology. Ethics only makes sense if it is based on the nature of self and\nreality.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This makes Hindu ethics unique in terms of other views that separate\nethics as separate discipline. Dharma is the greatest and the most valuable contribution\nto humanity by India. All our present day problems are a direct result of\ndisregarding 'Dharma' , under the influence of a materialistic philosophy, ( dished\nout by foreign funded media and TV )in the belief that it alone can usher in\nhappiness and secure the welfare of the people. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dharma is a Sanskrit expression of the widest\nimport. &nbsp;There is no corresponding word\nin any other language\u2014for righteous conduct in every sphere of activity.</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dharma\nsustains the society.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dharma ensures the well being and progress\nof humanity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-MTCA-Gdqt_w/UdEIYa7TuqI/AAAAAAAAjuw/m8S-39IQWkM/s800/Levels_of_Dharma.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-MTCA-Gdqt_w/UdEIYa7TuqI/AAAAAAAAjuw/m8S-39IQWkM/s400/Levels_of_Dharma.jpg\" height=\"400\" width=\"295\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: red;\">Above: Protecting the environment, flora and fauna is the Dharma of a Hindu.</span></i></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The life of a man as\nper Dharma is broken down into four stages\u2014 you could call this periods of 25\nyears each..</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BRAHMACHARYA: The first\nis the student stage. The student is unmarried and hence called a brahmacarin.\nHe devotes himself to studies in a gurukula ( school ) under a Guru ( teacher )\n. &nbsp;During this stage his dharma is to\nacquire knowledge and skills and kept his mind and body supremely fit. &nbsp;He is required to cultivate moral character\nand discipline which would enable him to develop his personality so that he\nwould not only be useful to himself but also to the members of the family and\nto society as well. During this stage he cannot lead a wanton life.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GRIHASTA:&nbsp; By now he can becomes a householder and\nmarry.&nbsp; He must continue his lineage an\nprocreate.&nbsp; He must earn &nbsp;legitimate income and through it to serve the\nfamily and the society. He must maintain sexual morality and keep his family\nhappy by providing for them every which way . He must strive to educate his\nchildren and make them worthy citizens. &nbsp;Marriage is a compromise where you create a\nsense of belonging.&nbsp; He has a dharma to\nbe useful to society. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">VANAPRASTHA:&nbsp; In this stage a man must gain spiritual\nknowledge and do meditation and yoga.&nbsp; He\nmust now loosen his attachment to wordly and material life . &nbsp;He must retire from earning activities and devoting\nmore time to the service of society. &nbsp;He\nmust give back what you have taken from society with interest. This could be\nskills or knowledge. During this period, he is required to encourage his sons\nto take up family responsibility and of course get good vetted spouses for\nthem. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SANYASA : In the final\nstage man must get seclusion and renounce the material life to lead of life of\nspirituality . He must turn his mind towards God or Paramatma. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thus, the four Ashramas\nwere by and large intended to secure human excellence by requiring an\nindividual to discharge the four pious obligations in an effective manner, and\nby leading a purposeful life. &nbsp;This\narrangement was intended not only to ensure that an individual would not go\nastray but also that he would follow the path of righteousness through out his\nlife.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Dharma of the wind\nto blow, the Dharma of the sun to heat up the world and sustain life, the\nDharma of fire to burn. &nbsp;It is the Dharma\nof the Plants to give out oxygen . It is the dharma of animals and humans to\ngive out carbon dioxide and plants to take in carbon di oxide at night . &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And behind the delicate workings and\ninter-relations between the various cosmic phenomena, there is an order, an\nintelligently engineered and organized system, a set of laws that seem to be at\nwork governing the great forces and powers (Shakti) at play behind these laws. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is Rita , the cosmic order, that includes\nmany dynamic sub-orders, each represented by powers and forces of great intensity\nand magnitude, each governed by their own dharma or internal law of being and\nworking \u2013 each interacting upon one another, within the boundaries of that law,\nsustaining, maintaining and upholding all things material and phenomenal in\nthis universe.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Our ancient seers and\nmaharishis saw rights and responsibilities as two sides of the same coin and\ndecided to emphasize responsibilities and duty over rights, &nbsp;whereas other civilizations emphasized rights.\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They knew that when\nresponsibilities and duties are fulfilled, people receive their rights. For\nexample, when parents fulfill their duties and responsibilities for their\nchildren--their children receive their rights. The same principle applies for a\nnation and its citizens. Where people live in conformity with their dharma, the\nindividual rights of all others are naturally granted.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Mangal&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092f\u0924\u094b\u092d\u094d\u092f\u0941\u0926\u092f\u0928\u093f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">:</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Mangal&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0936\u094d\u0930\u0947\u092f\u0938\u0938\u093f\u0926\u094d\u0927\u093f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">:\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Mangal&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0938</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Mangal&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0927\u0930\u094d\u092e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">:\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Mangal&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0964</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Mangal&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Meaning : &nbsp;Dharma is that by means of which one acquires\nprosperity and the ultimate upliftment. <b>Vaisheshik\nSutras 1.12<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Mangal&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0936\u094d\u0930\u0947\u092f\u093e\u0928\u094d\u0938\u094d\u0935\u0927\u0930\u094d\u092e\u094b</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Mangal&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0935\u093f\u0917\u0941\u0923</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">:\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Mangal&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u0930\u0927\u0930\u094d\u092e\u093e\u0924\u094d\u0938\u094d\u0935\u0928\u0941\u0937\u094d\u0920\u093f\u0924\u093e\u0924\u094d</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Mangal&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0964</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Mangal&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0938\u094d\u0935\u0927\u0930\u094d\u092e\u0947</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Mangal&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0928\u093f\u0927\u0928\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Mangal&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0936\u094d\u0930\u0947\u092f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">:\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Mangal&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u0930\u0927\u0930\u094d\u092e\u094b</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Mangal&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092d\u092f\u093e\u0935\u0939</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">:\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Mangal&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0964\u0964</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n- </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Mangal&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0936\u094d\u0930\u0940</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Mangal&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092e\u0939\u093e\u092d\u093e\u0930\u0924</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Mangal&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u096c</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Mangal&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0968\u096d</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Mangal&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0969\u096b</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Mangal&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Meaning : One's own\ncode of dharma is superior even if it be faulty in comparison to another's code\nof righteousness &nbsp;which may be easier to\nadopt. &nbsp;<b>Mahabharata 6.27.35<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<b><a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-4JCR8icZ5vU/UdCEpSqfsdI/AAAAAAAAjuQ/bWCfhBF4eSg/s675/cf5a3012bd11b4e28ce6742173923318-675.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-4JCR8icZ5vU/UdCEpSqfsdI/AAAAAAAAjuQ/bWCfhBF4eSg/s400/cf5a3012bd11b4e28ce6742173923318-675.jpg\" height=\"201\" width=\"400\" /></a></b></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The belief in the\nexistence of the all-pervasive Divinity in the universe creates an attitude of acceptance,\nreverence, benevolence and compassion for all things and beings in the mind of\na Hindu. He does not see any intrinsic evil in Nature. He sees the ground, the\nsky, the trees, the hills and mountains, and the rivers all sacred. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A Hindu considers life\na divine pilgrimage from \"unreal to real, darkness to light, and death to\nimmortality.\" &nbsp;Being on this road of\npilgrimage, a Hindu has no intention to hurt anyone. He is thoroughly convinced\nthat whatever he does in this life will come back to him in the next life. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thus he must do good\nand be good now, as he will have to come back again and again in this world\nuntil all karma scores are settled. This is why a beggar with just a loin cloth\nas his property does NOT attack anybody on the streets , like in countries\nwhere Christianity rules.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: magenta; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">In Muslim countries they are plain scared of losing their neck or limb. &nbsp;It is NOT morality which deters them-- just raw fear of severe painful retribution. &nbsp;This is like you wife makes bed tea for you , because she is afraid of getting slapped -- NOT out of love.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-OfTfoNgT36k/UdCE4npUKrI/AAAAAAAAjuY/q0ovJckL32U/s960/382091_476552372397424_628641617_n.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-OfTfoNgT36k/UdCE4npUKrI/AAAAAAAAjuY/q0ovJckL32U/s400/382091_476552372397424_628641617_n.jpg\" height=\"225\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Saraswati is the goddess\nof learning and knowledge. Thus, if a Hindu wants to pray for acquiring\nknowledge and understanding, he prays to Saraswat\u00ee. &nbsp;Just as sunlight cannot have a separate and\nindependent existence from the sun itself, a Hindu deity does not have a\nseparate and independent existence from the Supreme Being. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thus, Hindu worship of deities is monotheistic\npolytheism and not simple polytheism. .Hindus declare that there is only one\nSupreme Being and He is the God of all religions, which is the morphogenetic\nfield of consciousness ( the intelligent empty space within the atom )<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-84KgHqp8M7c/UdEH7RG8fGI/AAAAAAAAjuo/_6Zh2GV9zVs/s203/Upanishad.list.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-84KgHqp8M7c/UdEH7RG8fGI/AAAAAAAAjuo/_6Zh2GV9zVs/s320/Upanishad.list.jpg\" height=\"320\" width=\"286\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><b><span style=\"color: purple;\">Above: There are 108 Upanishads , the number of beads in a rudraksha mala .&nbsp;</span></b></i></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><b><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></b></i>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The person who hates\nnone, who is friendly and has compassion for all, who has no selfishness and\nego, who , maintains balance of mind in pain and pleasure, who has contentment,\nis steady in meditation, self controlled, and firm in his decision, who is dedicated\nto me, and who is my devotee is dear to me.<b>\nBhagavadgita, Chapter XII-13-14</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-tHfn8zVUTO4/UdMdubkWixI/AAAAAAAAjwI/f548VIdlMUE/s261/download+(2).jpge4r2.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-tHfn8zVUTO4/UdMdubkWixI/AAAAAAAAjwI/f548VIdlMUE/s400/download+(2).jpge4r2.jpg\" height=\"400\" width=\"295\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Let the sastras be your\nauthority in deciding what you should do and what you should desist from doing.\nHaving understood what is ordained by the Sastras, you should act accordingly. <b>Bhagawat Gita 16-24<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As per Christianity,\nevery man is a sinner till he is saved by Jesus. Christian salvation is the so\ncalled solution to the problem of Eternal Damnation caused by Original Sin. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But that problem does\nnot exist within the Hindu dharma traditions. &nbsp;Why should you be saved when you have NOT been\ncondemned in the first place. You have a clear conscience and you have NOT\nstitched up anybody.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Imagine someone asking\nyou if you have been pardoned from your prison sentence, and you wonder what\neffin\u2019 prison sentence. &nbsp;You have no sin hooks\non your body dragging you to eternal hell which has to be unhooked by the Lord\n(PBUH ).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Christianity's\nfundamental tenet is that that every human is born a sinner and remains so\nuntil he surrenders himself to Jesus Christ.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hinduism is the\nreligion of bliss. It considers the Right of Happiness to be the highest\nfundamental right of all humans. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As an essential\nprerequisite for the Right to Happiness, the Rig Veda unequivocally declares\nthat all human beings are equal.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Vedas and\nUpanishads were the primordial source of Dharma, a compendious term for all\nHuman Rights and Duties, the observance of which was regarded as essential for\nsecuring peace and happiness to individuals and society. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Smritis and Puranas\nwere collections of the rules of Dharma including Civil Rights and criminal\nliabilities (Vyavahara Dharma) as also Raja Dharma (Constitutional Law). &nbsp;There were also several other authoritative\nworks on Raja Dharma,&nbsp; the Kamandaka,\nShukra Niti and Kautilya\u2019s Artha Shastra. &nbsp;All of them unanimously declare that the\nobjective of the State was to secure happiness of all.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Samani Prapaa Saha\nVonnabhagah<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Samane Yoktre Saha vo\nYunajmi<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Aaraah Nabhimivaabhitah</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cAll have equal Rights\nto articles of food and water. The yoke of the chariot of life is placed\nequally on the shoulders of all. All should live together in harmony supporting\none another like the spokes of a wheel of the chariot connecting its rim and\nhub\u201d. <b>(Atharva Veda \u2013 Samjnana Sukta).</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Narada Smriti, requires\nthe king to protect non-believers too.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>\u201cPashandanaigama sreni\npoogavraata ganadishu<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Samrakshet samayam Raja\nDurge Janapade Tatha\u201d</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cThe king should accord\nprotection to compacts of associations of believers of Vedas (Naigamas) as also\nthe non-believers (Pashandis) and others\u201d <b>(Narada\nSmriti, Dharma Kosha)<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cWe not only tolerate,\nbut we Hindus accept every religion \u2026. Knowing that all religions, from the\nlowest fetishism to the highest absolutism, mean so many attempts of the human\nsoul to grasp and realize the infinite, each determined by the conditions of\nits birth and association, and each of them marking a stage of progress\u201d \u2013 &nbsp;<b>Hinduism\nexpert, Swami Vivekananda at the World Parliament of Religions in Chicago in\n1893</b>.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The secular ideals of\nEurope are nascent in front of the Hindu ideal of \u2018Sarva Dharma Samabhav\u2019 \u2013\n\u2018Equal Respect for all Religions\u2019. Whereas the secular ideology stops at\ncalling for \u2018tolerance\u2019 to the diversity,&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hinduism goes much further. It\ndoesn\u2019t just tolerate; it accepts every religion. It transcends all barriers of\nreligious bigotry and even celebrates diversity. Diversity in form and unity in\nspirit is what Hinduism stands for.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Before 7000 BC, India\nruled the whole world. &nbsp;After 7000 BC,\nIndia ruled from Jeruslam to Urals to Vietnam.&nbsp;\nThe ancient Maharishis of that era, have said that &nbsp;that &nbsp;the whole humanity is like a big extended\nfamily.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Samaani va Aakootihi\nSamaanaa Hridayaanivah<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Samaanamastu vo Mano\nYathaa Vah Susahaasati</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; RigVeda, Mandala-10, Sukta-191,\nMantra-4<o:p></o:p></span></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;\u201cLet there be oneness in your resolutions,\nhearts and minds; let the determination to live with mutual cooperation be firm\nin you all\u201d.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The modern globalist\nwant us to believe that the whole world is a huge market. While the generous &nbsp;ancient Hindus &nbsp;(of Vasudhaiva Kutumbakam \u2013 the world as one\nFamily) &nbsp;stood for one harmonious world,\nthe greedy globalisation cartel stands for one vulgar market. &nbsp;In reality what we are actually achieving is\nnot globalisation, but Walmart-isation and Monsato-isation.</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Prajasukhe Sukham\nRajnah Prajanam cha Hite Hitam<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Naatmapriyam Hitam\nRajnah Prajanaam tu Priyam Hitam</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cIn the happiness of\nthe subjects lies the happiness of the King; in their welfare his welfare. The\nKing shall not consider what pleases himself as good; whatever pleases his\nsubjects is only good for him\u201d <b>(Artha\nShastra)<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These Fundamental\nRights represent the basic values cherished by the Indians since the Vedic\ntimes and they are calculated to protect the dignity and happiness of the\nindividual and create conditions in which every human being can develop his\npersonality to the fullest extent.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Manusmriti mandates that\nhighest respect and regard must be extended to women. Gods are pleased, with\nthe house in which women are respected, in that house in which women are\ninsulted and are made to suffer, every thing done is sure to go waste. &nbsp;If in a house daughter, the daughter-in-law,\nand the sisters 'and other women suffer, that house is sure to be destroyed. &nbsp;The house in which such women live happily,\nsecures wealth and happiness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cIt may be confidently\nasserted that in no nation of antiquity were women held in so much esteem as\namongst Hindus\u201d&nbsp; Prof Horace Heyman\nWilson Director , Royal Asiatic Society.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-7nSr0MXZzNs/UdL4b4P--VI/AAAAAAAAjvA/vvMFI3K8jVU/s688/indianwomen.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-7nSr0MXZzNs/UdL4b4P--VI/AAAAAAAAjvA/vvMFI3K8jVU/s400/indianwomen.jpg\" height=\"275\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;;\"><i><b><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">Above : Hinduism is a religion which has withstood the VULGAR&nbsp;</span></span><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">proselyting</span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;onslaught of Islam ( by sword ) and Christianity ( by sops ) for 800 years.</span></span></b></i></span><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Indians who were\ntaken abroad as slaves by the British, &nbsp;by&nbsp;DECEIT MOST FOUL also hung on to their religion against all odds.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punch in Google search </span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>THE\nINDENTURED COOLIE, SLAVERY REINVENTED VADAKAYIL</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Muslim priesthood\ntill today sanctifies four wives and gives abusive religious dictats called\n\"fatwa\" from the mosque. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Christian priesthood\nclaims superiority and entices the poor and vulnerable of other faiths to conversion with immoral\nsops. &nbsp;This type of sops is what a\npedophile uses on 4 year old girls\u2014first give a lollipop to suck on, and then\nlater something else..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>It is NOT allowed to exploit human vulnerability as per Hindu dharma.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-CBmpxL8LKs8/UdMFTMTQ2RI/AAAAAAAAjvo/qG8AgQovUxs/s275/download.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-CBmpxL8LKs8/UdMFTMTQ2RI/AAAAAAAAjvo/qG8AgQovUxs/s400/download.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dharma has attributes\nlike &nbsp;rationality, sense of duty,\njustice, peace, truthfulness, hospitality, kindness , respect, compassion, non-violence, rectitude, humanity,\nspirituality, fairness , patience, self restraint , tolerance, ethics, service to others,&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">right to life , natural\njustice, virtue, morality, bonafide work</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;and philanthropy. &nbsp;Dharma thus truly symbolises universal values\nof humanism and forms the basis of global ethics.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tadrisho\nayam anuprashno yatra dharmaha sudurlabaha<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dushkamha\npralisankhyatum tatkenatra vysvasyathi<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prabhavarthaya\nbhutanam dharmapravachanam kritam<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yasyat\nprabhavasamyuktaha sa dharma iti nischayaha<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is most difficult to\ndefine Dharma. Dharma has been explained to be that which helps the upliftment\nof living beings. Therefore, that which ensures the welfare of living beings is\nsurely Dharma. The learned rishis have declared that that which sustains is\nDharma.-- <b>Bhishma to Yuddhistra Mahabharata</b>\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Respect for all\nreligions is Dharma. &nbsp;&nbsp;Dharma is universal, it applies to all whether\nthey belong to any religion or not. &nbsp;It\nis a code of conduct for all human beings for all time to come. &nbsp;It is eternal and unalterable just as you cannot\nalter the property of fire of burning and of water of flowing.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The goal of dharma is\nto raise the quality of life , ensure spiritual awaking and fulfill humanity\u2019s\ndestiny. To be a Hindu, you don\u2019t need any certificate from any temple, church\nor mosque or praying house . &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You need\nnot recite any verse. &nbsp;You need not\nbelieve in any particular God or book. &nbsp;You\nsimply have to have a conscience and be honest to yourself. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Can anybody be a Muslim\nif he outrightly rejects Quran? Can anybody be a &nbsp;Christian if he outrightly rejects the holy Bible\n? &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Can any Muslim in\nPakistan or Saudi Arabia say in public to other muslims that he wants to\nconvert to Christianity, and still hope to be alive the next day?</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">As long as a Muslim in in minority he wants a\nSECULAR government. But soon he will procreate like mice ( if conversions by\nforce are NOT happeneing ) and then as soon as he is in majority he wants\nSHARIA Islamic government with religious police to enforce .</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But yes, one can be a\nHindu even if he outrightly rejects the Vedas.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Scientists have found\nout today that Vedic mantras &nbsp;have\ntherapeutic and psychological benefits even when recited without understanding\nthem. For Sanskrit emanated from the DNA of seers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punch into google\nsearch \u2013<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>POWER OF MANTRAS ON\nHUMAN CONSCIOUSNESS &nbsp;VADAKAYIL</b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-52lLhNxviks/UdMDy_gJJ2I/AAAAAAAAjvQ/WoGYnjeicHk/s243/dseryh.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-52lLhNxviks/UdMDy_gJJ2I/AAAAAAAAjvQ/WoGYnjeicHk/s320/dseryh.jpg\" height=\"320\" width=\"273\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hinduism\u2019s goal is to\nprovide a nurturing platform for all.&nbsp; Hinduism\nallows different options to all of us at all times to choose what is naturally\nbest for us and progress from there. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hinduism\nexisted when division of humans on basis of religion was non-existent. Hinduism\nis a \u2018celebration\u2019 of \u2018being human\u2019. Hinduism, is a synonym for \u2018being human\u2019.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vedic provisions\nforcefully declare equality among all human beings. They impresses that just as\nno spoke of a wheel is superior to another, no individual can claim to be, or\nregarded as, superior to others. This was the grand concept of equality in\nIndia.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-uCG6W7L4ZK8/UdMERMvr0NI/AAAAAAAAjvY/7CsyC9jFkk4/s267/images.jpguhibyoi.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-uCG6W7L4ZK8/UdMERMvr0NI/AAAAAAAAjvY/7CsyC9jFkk4/s320/images.jpguhibyoi.jpg\" height=\"320\" width=\"226\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\">Below is a British stooge BR Ambedkar, who was used to divide Hindus, for divide and rule. You will understand the vulgar games this man played , if you punch into Google search -</span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>CNN IBN POLL GREATEST INDIAN SINCE MAHATMA GANDHI VADAKAYIL</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dharanat\ndharma mityahu dharmo dhara-yate prajaha<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yat\nsyad dharanasamyuktam sa dharma iti nischayaha<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dharma sustains the\nsociety.&nbsp; Dharma maintains the social\norder.&nbsp; Dharma ensures well being and\nprogress of humanity. &nbsp;Dharma is surely\nthat which fulfills these objectives<b>-&nbsp; Lord Krishna To Arjuna Karna Parva, Mahabharata<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">People from other\nreligions ridicule Hindus for having so many dieties. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">My answer to them is\nthis. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Are any of these deities\nimposed on Hindus ? &nbsp;Or is the deity chosen\nby a Hindus free choice? &nbsp;Is any holy\nbook or messiah or place of worship &nbsp;ever\nimposed on a Hindu? &nbsp;Does any Hindus ever\nclaim that only he is on the right path? &nbsp;This is the uniqueness of Hindu Dharma. This\nis the all-encompassing pervasiveness of Hindu Dharma. This is the proof of the\ngreatness of Hindu Dharma.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In fact the supreme brahmAn\n\u2013 the morphogenetic consciousness field \u2013 &nbsp;is just an intelligent empty space which\ncontrols every electron.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hindu Dharma considers\ncompassion and moral conscience in human beings sacred. &nbsp;Other religions &nbsp;preach that \u2018man is a sinner and God sends His\nProphet to the earth for his emancipation\u2019. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Mangal&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0927\u093e\u0930\u0923\u093e\u0924\u094d</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Mangal&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0927\u0930\u094d\u092e\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Mangal&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0907\u0924\u094d\u092f\u093e\u0939\u0941\u0930\u094d\u0927\u0930\u094d\u092e\u094b</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Mangal&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0927\u093e\u0930\u092f\u0924\u0940</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;;
