, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">7c)One who is efficient\nin<i> kraya</i> (purchasing) and <i>vikraya</i> (selling) daily earns his livelihood by his\nbusiness, one who does <i>pashu paalana</i> (animal husbandry and farming are called\nVAISHYA in this world.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">7d)Those who are in the\nservice of the <i>dwija</i> (BRAHMANA, KSHATRIYA AND VAISHYA, brave, gentle have control\nover their senses, carry plough (<i> hala</i> ),<i> kaashta</i> (wood) and <i>trina</i> (grass) are\ncalled SHUDRA.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">8)Those who abandon\ntheir own <i>dharma</i> ( religion) lack kindness, cause harm to others, possess\nexcessive anger and are violent are called MLECCHA and they lack the power of reasoning (<i> viveka </i>).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">9)As the destiny is,\naccordingly one gets friends (good or evil) All the actions of the world are\nbased on <i>bhagya</i>- destiny and<i> purushartha</i>- labour, actions committed in the\nprevious birth are destiny and actions committed in this life are called <i>purushartha</i>. Thus <i>karmas</i> have been differentiated in two ways whichever of the\ntwo ( <i>bhagya </i>and <i>purushartha</i>) is powerful forces the other to surrender. The\nstrength cannot be identified merely by analyzing the results of the Karma or\nby any other means.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It would not have been\npossible to destroy the evils and evil doers if the destiny was unchangeable\nthat is <i>purushartha</i> (labour) can change even the<i> bhagya</i> (destiny) If the\ndestiny is unfavourable then the most virtuous of actions gives bad results\njust like the king Mahabali who was tied up even after being so charitable and\nHarishchandra had to serve a MLECHA, even after being a Truthful man.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">10)Good actions give good\nresults and evil actions give bad results, so one must accept good actions and\nreject evil actions as described in the scriptures.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">SEE HOW SHREWDLY THE WHITE CHRISTIAN MAN DIVIDED INDIANS AND RULED US ON THE BASIS OF 4 CASTES-- &nbsp;<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">SAYING THAT OUR CASTE IS BY BIRTH</span></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punch into Google\nsearch </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>THE UNTOUCHABLES VADAKAYIL</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-rjRCZk0HOiE/UbVAq4bAcgI/AAAAAAAAjH4/q2a9C2-PRLk/s1600/untitledy.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-rjRCZk0HOiE/UbVAq4bAcgI/AAAAAAAAjH4/q2a9C2-PRLk/s400/untitledy.png\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ramayana records that\nShukracharya made Dandakaranya region barren after his beautiful daughter Araja\nwas molested by King Danda. Shukracharya was the guru of Prahalada too.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Puranas allude to a\ncosmic war between the Devas, led by Brihaspati of the Angirasa line of seers and\nthe Asuras (Ahuras), led by Shukracharya ( Kava Ushana) of the Brighu line of\nseers. &nbsp;As such the Asura-Daeva split was\nalready in place by Zarathushtras\u2019 time.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is very easy to seek\nout the history of the Parsis . Wherever they existed there were \u201ctowers of\nsilence\u201d . Even when they moved away,nobody dared to destroy these gruesome\nplaces. Parsis had also settled down in Sind. &nbsp;The Parsi Navroz is an important celebration\nfor Kashmiri Pandits .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maharishi Kashayapa ,\nthe son of Marichi , had two wives. &nbsp;His\nfirst wife Aditi bore the Deva ( gods ) lineage. &nbsp;His second wife Diti bore the asura ( demons )\nlineage.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Valley of Kashmir got its name from Kashyap Maharishi.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Kashmir, even Muslim Shias are surprisingly known to\nbe observing this feast.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">No wonder </span><b style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Shukrawar\n</span></b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">(Friday ) is a holiday for the Muslims.</span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Avesta is the\nprimary collection of sacred texts of Zoroastrianism, and is composed in the\nAvestan language. &nbsp;Avesta also means \"to\nknow\" and thus is a teaching about the secret.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ahura Mazda means \u201call knowing\ngod\u201d. Ahura is all light, truth, goodness, and knowledge;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-docqgBDw28k/UbW6zAnBJII/AAAAAAAAjJQ/0i2AoUhlMyI/s1600/images.jpggfjfn.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"299\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-docqgBDw28k/UbW6zAnBJII/AAAAAAAAjJQ/0i2AoUhlMyI/s400/images.jpggfjfn.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Angra Mainyu is all\ndarkness, falsehood, wickedness, and ignorance. Ahura dwells in the infinite\nlight; Angra Mainyu dwells in the infinite night. Whatever the good Spirit\nmakes, the evil Spirit mars.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Veda Yama, the son of Vivasvat, is the king\nof the dead.&nbsp; His Avesta counterpart is\nYima, the son of Vivanghat, is the first king. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Zarathushtra has been\nknown in the West as Zoroaster, from the Greek transliteration of his name; in\nPersia and India he is known as Zarthosht. &nbsp;His father's name was Pourushapa and his\nmother's name Dughdova bear striking resemblance with the Sanskrit words having\nthe same meaning. &nbsp;This a combination of\nthe two words Pourushapa or Purusha in Sanskrit which means man and Aspa, which\nbecomes Ashva in Sanskrit which means a horse. The term Dughda in Duagdova\nmeans milk in Sanskrit and Avestan.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A large section of\nParsis are vegetarian and during weddings/navjyots, there is always a\n\"parsi vegetarian\" menu. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the\nMahabharat, Karna is depicted as taking the Asura vows during battle, which\nincludes (1) not allowing anyone to wash his feet (2) not to touch meat. This\nshows that Asuras were in fact vegetarians. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The word Asura occurs 88 times in the Rig Veda\nof 5000 BC. Agni has total of 12 Asura descriptions, Varuna has 10, Mitra 8,\nand Rudra 6. &nbsp;The Bhagawat Gita , chapter\n16 uses the term asuric to describe egoistic.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are strong\nlinguistic and cultural similarities between the texts of the Avesta and those\nof the Rigveda . The hallucinogenic Soma of Rig Veda is nothing but the Haoma\nin Zend Avesta.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Vedic Yatus are found unaltered in the Avesta. The Yatu in\nthe Vedas is the demon taking any form he pleases, the fiend as a wizard: so he\nis in the Avesta also, where the name is likewise extended to the Yatu, the\nsorcerer. &nbsp;With the Yatus are often\nassociated the Pairikas (Apasara ).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The term Parsi , coined\nby Frenchman Jew Anquetil-Duperron which means Persian, &nbsp;is not attested in Indian Zoroastrian texts\nuntil the 17th century. &nbsp;Until that time,\nsuch texts consistently use either Zarthoshti, &nbsp;\"Zoroastrian\" or Vehdin, \"of the\ngood religion\u201d. &nbsp;However both the Puranas\nand the Mahabharata of 4000 BC, use the term Parasikas to refer to the peoples\nwest of the Indus river.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The first part, or the\nAvesta properly so called, contains the Vendidad, the Visperad, and the Yasna. The\nVendidad is a corruption of Vidaevadata, \"against the demons\".<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-QQaEqfhH-iU/UbW9XkbBB9I/AAAAAAAAjJo/awvp0-27oLc/s1600/ahuramazda600a.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"358\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-QQaEqfhH-iU/UbW9XkbBB9I/AAAAAAAAjJo/awvp0-27oLc/s400/ahuramazda600a.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Vendidad is a\ncompilation of religious laws and of mythical tales; the Visperad is a\ncollection of litanies for the sacrifice; and the Yasna is composed of litanies\nof the same kind and of five hymns or Gathas written in a special dialect,\nolder than the general language of the Avesta. The second part, generally known\nas the Khorda Avesta or 'Small Avesta,' is composed of short prayers which are\nrecited not only by the priests, but by all the faithful, at certain moments of\nthe day, month, or year, and in presence of the different elements; these\nprayers are the five Gah, the thirty formulas of the Sirozah, the three Afrigan,\nand the six Nyayis.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The prophet Zarathushtra, son of Pourushaspa, is known to\nus primarily from the Gathas, seventeen great hymns which he composed and which\nhave been faithfully preserved by his community. These are not works of\ninstruction, but inspired, passionate utterances, many of them addressed\ndirectly to God. The language of these hymns resembles that of the Indian\nRigveda.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-XYo3Z9s6KnM/UbW9fY8wWaI/AAAAAAAAjJw/-T_ipnCh958/s1600/ahuramazda600.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"263\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-XYo3Z9s6KnM/UbW9fY8wWaI/AAAAAAAAjJw/-T_ipnCh958/s400/ahuramazda600.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An example: I shall\nrecognize Thee as strong and holy, Ahuramazda, when Thou wilt help me by the\nhand with which Thou holdest the recompenses that Thou wilt give, through the\nheat of Thy truth-strong fire, to the wicked man and the just - and when the\nmight of Good Purpose shall come to me. Then as holy I have recognized Thee,\nAhuramazda, when I saw Thee as First at the birth of life, when Thou didst\nappoint rewards for acts and words, bad for the bad, a good recompense for the\ngood by Thy innate virtue, at the final turning point of the creation [i.e.,\nthe Last Judgment]. [Yasna 43.4-5]<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Gathas\u2019 &nbsp;were recited by the Zoroastrians in their\ndaily liturgy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">What remains of the\nAvesta today, is about a quarter of the Great Avesta of the sixth century. The\nreligion propagated by Zarathustra in ancient Iran was a branch of Vedic\nknowledge. Only the language differs: Iranian (sometimes called Avestan or Old\nIranian) instead of Sanskrit. . In other words, ancient Iranians were from\nancient India. No wonder Iranians love to call themselves Aryas and they named\nthey National Shippping Company ARYA LINES ( the present day IRISL ) <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Zend Avesta is divided\ninto three parts: (a) yashna, (b) vendidad and (c) yashta. Yashna is a\ncolloquial distortion of yagna. The rituals involving fires and invocations of\nGods in the Zend Avesta bear uncanny resemblance to the vedic yagna. Moreover,\nyashna is also called gatha, and the exact same word is used in Sanskrit for\nthe vedic prayers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The very word Iran is\nonly a spacio-temporal distortion of the word Aryan.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As proof of this\nstatement, I would like to present the following sloka from ManuSamhita:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">shanakaistu\nkriyaalopaadimaah kshatriyajaatayoh<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">vrishalatvam gataaloke\nbraahmanaadarshanena ca<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">poundrkaashcodradaavidaah\nkambojaah yanaashokaah<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">paaradaa\npahlavaarshceenaah kiraataah daradaakhashaah<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(<i>Translation: The\nancient name of Persia (Paarasya in Sanskrit) was Paarada. On breaking down of\nthe family and other social structures, a section of kshatriyas came to be\ncalled as shudra at first and yavana later. The inhabitants of Persia belong to\nthat group</i>.)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Max M\u00fcller, too, in his\nLectures on the Sanskrit Language infers, albeit without any proof, \u201cThe\nZoroastrians were a colony from Northern India.\u201d &nbsp;Iran, as we all know, is yet another ancient\nname for Persia. The Iranians sometimes pronounce it as \u201cAiran\u201d, as mentioned\nin Ferdowsi\u2019s Shahname. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Vedic Vayupurana\nmention Chandravanshi king &nbsp;Pururavaa and\nhis Queen Ira. The same puranas also describes a battle waged among the Suryavanshi\nand Chandravanshi lienages. It was as a result of this war that part of the Chandravanshi\nclan had to immigrate to the modern Iran. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Zoroastrianism does not\nteach or believe in reincarnation or karma.&nbsp;\nZoroastrians believe that after life on earth, the human soul is judged\nby God as to whether it did more good or evil in its life.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Parsis wear a Kusti\n(a holy thread around their waist) which corresponds to the \u201cHindu Yagnopavit\u201d &nbsp;poonoolu worn around the shoulder and the\nwaist.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Parsis use coconuts\nand rice during their Navjyot and wedding ceremonies like the Hindus. The Parsi\nritual invocation of the Fire is called Yasna (Jashn) which corresponds to the\nHindu ritual of Yagna<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The principles of\nZoroaster-</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1)Worship Ahura-mazda<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2)Magnify the\narchangels ( auras )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3)Damn the demons (\ndevas )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4)Marry you nearest\nrelative.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-qgHj6bKAWlQ/UbW_ncYfa8I/AAAAAAAAjKY/uzlgg-H_zpI/s1600/images.jpgngfje.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-qgHj6bKAWlQ/UbW_ncYfa8I/AAAAAAAAjKY/uzlgg-H_zpI/s400/images.jpgngfje.jpg\" width=\"339\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">His principle No 4, was\nhis undoing, in his haste to mirror Hinduism, where we have strict Y Chromosome\nrules. ( Gotra rules ).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: small;\">Punch into Google\nsearch- </span><b><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">GOTRA SYSTEM &nbsp;KHAP RULES &nbsp;Y CHROMOSOME &nbsp;DNA VADAKAYIL</span></b><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-9Ajfu7Gg-vs/UbW-4mlK2HI/AAAAAAAAjKA/Vx9ILFGANUs/s1600/images.jpgyhngn.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-9Ajfu7Gg-vs/UbW-4mlK2HI/AAAAAAAAjKA/Vx9ILFGANUs/s1600/images.jpgyhngn.jpg\" width=\"350\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After the conversion of\nKing Vishtaspa, Zoroaster remained at the court of the king. &nbsp;Other officials were converted, &nbsp;and a daughter of Zoroaster married the king.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Zoroaster lived for 77\nyears, and he died in 551 BC.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n\n\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Zoroaster\u2019s birthday is\ncelebrated on March 21, as part of the Persian New Year Festival. &nbsp;With his wife, Huvovi, Zoroaster had three\nsons, Isat Vastar, Uruvat-Nara and Hvare Cira and three daughters, Freni,\nPourucista and Triti. &nbsp;His wife, children\nand a cousin named Maidhyoimangha, were his first converts after he decided to\nmirror Hinduism and create his own religion , like another Indian Buddha in\n1900 BC --at age 30.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-C_C7Ax71abk/UbWkE6nv3TI/AAAAAAAAjIg/OvhPfQKCCl8/s1600/download.jpg54u456u.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"298\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-C_C7Ax71abk/UbWkE6nv3TI/AAAAAAAAjIg/OvhPfQKCCl8/s400/download.jpg54u456u.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On the rock inscription\nof Elvend, which had been made by the order of king Darius, we read these lines\n:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>There is one God,\nomnipotent Ahura Mazda,<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>It is He who has\ncreated the earth here;<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>It is He who has\ncreated the heaven there;</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>It is He who has\ncreated mortal man.</i><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-N4dpU4q_fVA/UbW7EspOxHI/AAAAAAAAjJY/rMm1xgx-sns/s1600/Ahura-Mazda-wings.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"253\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-N4dpU4q_fVA/UbW7EspOxHI/AAAAAAAAjJY/rMm1xgx-sns/s400/Ahura-Mazda-wings.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Avestan language is a\nmere dialect of Sanskrit,.. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Vendidad,\nHapta-Hindu (Sapta-Sindhu) is one of the 16 lands abandoned by ancient Iranians\nbecause of excessive heat.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the section of Zend\nAvesta titled Vendidad, Ahura Mazda tells Zarathustra of the sixteen perfect\nlands, and the penultimate in that list is hapta-hindu ( sapta-sindhu )\u2014&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">--like how\nSunil Seth becomes Hunil Heth TEEE HEEEEEE !!!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Digression: 38 years\nback, I had a friend by the name of Sunil Seth. &nbsp;When I wanted to piss him off , I would shout </span><span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: x-large; line-height: 150%;\">Hunil\nHeth</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"> , and he was sure to go into a deep sulk.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ns2eYfSNjlQ/UbW5oVJpgRI/AAAAAAAAjJA/-2KS4SGImw4/s1600/mzl.ovywckqs.320x480-75.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ns2eYfSNjlQ/UbW5oVJpgRI/AAAAAAAAjJA/-2KS4SGImw4/s400/mzl.ovywckqs.320x480-75.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>Brihaspati presides over guruvar ( Thursday ) .&nbsp;&nbsp;Brihaspati puja is on Thursdays.&nbsp;&nbsp;Brihaspativar is Thursday, a holy day for white European Christians.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Maundy Thursday is the day Jesus Christ washed the feet of his disciple. Thursday is ascension day for Christians.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>Shukravar ( Friday ) is a holy day for Muslims \u2013people from middle east who worshiped Shukracharya..</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<ol id=\"bc_0_83TB\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">PARSIS FLED FROM IRAN TO INDIA DUE TO PERSECUTION FROM ISLAM... ISLAM DID BURIAL ..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2015/02/madain-saleh-destruction-of-ancient.html</span></span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">THE PARSI IMMIGRANTS ARRIVED AT THE COURT OF GUJARATI KING VIJAYADITYA..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">THE KING ASKED THEM , WHY THEY CAME TO INDIA?</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">THE LEADER OF THE PARIS SAID \" WE ARE ORIGINALLY FROM INDIA , WE FOLLOW INDIAN SAMSKARAS\"</span><br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: magenta;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">THE KING ASKED THEM TO RECITE THE VERSES OF 16 SAMSKARAS OF SANATANA DHARMA.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">THE PARSI LEADER NARRATED THE FIRST 15 -- BY RECITING SANSKRIT VERSES FROM THE UPANISADS..</span></span></b></div>\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: medium;\">WHEN THE FINAL AND 16TH VERSE WAS TO BE RECITED-- THE GUJARATI KING SAID --\"I WILL RECITE IT FOR YOU \"..</span></div>\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: medium;\"></span><br />\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: medium;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: medium;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">HE LAID OUT THE FINAL ANTHEYESTHI ( LAST FUNERAL RITE ) -- THAT PARSIS MUST NOT CREMATE AS PER HINDU RITES --THEY MUST FOLLOW ANOTHER CUSTOM WHICH WAS PREVALENT IN ANCIENT IRAN AMONG NON-HINDUS..THAT OF OFFERING THEIR DEAD BODIES TO VULTURES..</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">There are sixteen rituals (Shodasa samskaras) prescribed by scriptures and adhered across the land of Bharath for 30 millenniums.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">1/Garba Aadhana - Pre consummation rites which purify the parents</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">2/Pumsavana - Rites for the carrying mother</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">3/Simantonnayana - Prenatal rite for the protection of carrying mother and her womb</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">4/Jatakarma - Natal rite purifying the new born</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">5/Namakarana - Naming Ceremony</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">6/Nishkramana - Exposing the infant to outside world</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">7/Annaprashana - First Feeding of solid food</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">8/Chaulam - Tonsure</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">9/Karnavedhana - Piercing the ears</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">10/Aksharaabhyasa or Vidyaramba - Beginning of Education</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">11/Upanayana - Opening the eye of wisdom. Lit. bringing near the Guru, scripture and God. Investiture of Sacred Thread.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">12/Vedaarambha - Initiation into the Vedic Education</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">13/Keshanta or Ritusuddhi - Whole body Shave for boys or Nuptial rites for girls</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">14/Samaavartana - Convocation or Completion of Education</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">15/ Vivaha - Marriage</span><br />\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: medium;\">16/ Anthyeshti - Funeral Rites</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">AS PER THE KING, PARSIS WERE NOT ENTITLED TO MOKSHA IN THE HOLY LAND OF BHARAT..</span></b></span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2012/11/rip-impossible-with-burial-world-is.html</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">I AM SURE SUBRAMIAN SWAMY WOULD LOVE TO HEAR ABOUT HIS WIFEs RELIGION..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">capt ajit vadakayil</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">..</span><br />\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_17MN\" kind=\"m\" style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/10/comments-overflow-for-inoperative-load_20.html?showComment=1540130781713#c8373243367526785093\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"text-decoration-line: none;\">October 21, 2018 at 7:36 PM</a></span></span></b></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_86MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n</div>\n<div style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">\n<b><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">WE ASK PAPA FALI NARIMAN AND SON ROHINGTON NARIMAN TO BRING REFORMS IN THEIR OWN PARSI RELIGION..</span></b></div>\n<div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">THEY INTERMARRY .. PARSIS DIE FAST OR LIVE LONG BEDRIDDEN LIVES...</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">WHEN DEAD THE BODY OF A PARSI IS USUALLY PUMPED WITH ANTI-BIOTICS ..</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">WHEN THIS DEAD BODY IS PLACED ON THE TOWER OF SILENCE , VULTURES EAT THE BODY.</span><br /><b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">THE ANTI-BIOTICS IN THE DEAD PARSIS BODY KILLED THE GOOD MICRO BACTERIA IN THE GUT OF THE VULTURE .. THIS VULTURE GETS A BENT NECK CANT EAT OR DRINK WATER AND THEN DIES..</span></span></b><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">HULLO NARIMANS .. CHARITY BEGINS AT HOME..</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">WANNA SEE SOME GRUESOME PICTURES OF THE TOWER OF SILENCE IN MUMBAI ?</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/07/the-deep-state-and-shadow-government_26.html</span></span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\"><b><span style=\"color: magenta;\">65 PARSIS WERE KNIGHTED BY JEW ROTHSCHILD BEFORE 1947, NOT FOR HELPING BHARATMATA BUT FOR WHAT --WE ALL KNOW.. TODAY THEIR DESCENDANTS ARE ASHAMED AND THEY HIDE..</span></b></span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">WE ASK JUSTICE ROHINGTON NARIMAN TO SET HIS OWN RELIGION INTO ORDER BEFORE HE DEALS WITH SANATANA DHARMA\u2014 HE IS NOT QUALIFIED TO DEAL WITH INDIAN CULTURE , AS HE IS AN ALIEN IMMIGRANT PARSI\u2026</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">WE THE PEOPLE DO NOT WANT DISEASES TO BE SPREAD BY OBSOLETE RITUALS OF YORE, BASED ON NONSENSE SCIENCE.. WE SHALL NOT RUN THE FORTUNES OF BHARATMATA ON PARSI SENTIMENTS\u2026</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">THE ANCESTORS OF UBER RICH PARSIS OF TODAY WERE OPIUM DRUG RUNNING AGENTS OF JEW ROTHSCHILD AND JEW SASSOON...</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">PARSIS FLED FROM IRAN TO INDIA DUE TO PERSECUTION FROM ISLAM... ISLAM DID BURIAL ..</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">THE PARSI IMMIGRANTS ARRIVED AT THE COURT OF GUJARATI KING VIJAYADITYA..</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">THE KING ASKED THEM , WHY THEY CAME TO INDIA?</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">THE LEADER OF THE PARIS SAID \" WE ARE ORIGINALLY FROM INDIA , WE FOLLOW INDIAN SAMSKARAS\"</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">THE KING ASKED THEM TO RECITE THE VERSES OF 16 SAMSKARAS OF SANATANA DHARMA.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">THE PARSI LEADER NARRATED THE FIRST 15 -- BY RECITING SANSKRIT VERSES FROM THE UPANISADS..</span><br /><br /><b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">WHEN THE FINAL AND 16TH VERSE WAS TO BE RECITED-- THE GUJARATI KING SAID --\"I WILL RECITE IT FOR YOU \"..</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">HE LAID OUT THE FINAL ANTHEYESTHI ( LAST FUNERAL RITE ) -- THAT PARSIS MUST NOT CREMATE AS PER HINDU RITES --THEY MUST FOLLOW ANOTHER CUSTOM WHICH WAS PREVALENT IN ANCIENT IRAN AMONG NON-HINDUS..THAT OF OFFERING THEIR DEAD BODIES TO VULTURES.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">THE KING EXPECTED PARSIS TO REJECT THIS DEMAND.. AS THIS IS RELATED TO MOKSHA.. THE PARSIS DID NOT..</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">AS PER THE KING, PARSIS WERE NOT ENTITLED TO MOKSHA IN THE HOLY LAND OF BHARAT..</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">THE GUJARATI KING EXPECTED THE PARSIS TO GO BACK, IF THEY ARE REAL FOLLOWERS OF SANATANA DHARMA</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">THEY WERE NOT!</span></span></b><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">THEY JUST LEARNT THE 16 SAMSKARA VERSES IN SANSKRIT TO FOOL THE KING</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">THE GUJARATI KING WAS NOT AN IDIOT.</span><br /><br /><div>\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: large;\">THE ONLY REAL SAMSKARA OF A HINDU-- IS THAT HE MUST CREMATE HIS DEAD BODY ( TO FOLLOWS LAWS OF KARMA AND MOKSHA )</span></div>\n<div>\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>CULTURE IS EVERYTHING !</b></span></span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">capt ajit vadakayil</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">..</span><br />\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_86BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc;
